He supports his family through the sale of used clothing. Used clothing has a very big market share in Ghana, because brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically-active poor. Therefore, used clothing has created markets for many Ghanaians. 

Prince has been in this business for five years. He travels to the nearby city of Accra to purchase goods. He wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase his inventory. He believes this loan will help him save for the future.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fifteen sheep and five goats

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maria del Carmen tiene 59 años de edad, es casada con dos hijos mayores de edad, que ya están casados y con familias aparte. La señora Maria se dedica a la compra-venta de huevos y gallinas los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante en el mercado oriental de Managua. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace ya 14 años, ayudándole a vender a su mama que era la que originalmente tenía el negocio. Después decidió independizarse, compro 300 cajillas de huevos y empezó a venderlas en Managua. Actualmente están presentando un problema de que el precio del huevo se ha mostrado muy inestable, haciendo que cada día las ganancias de ella sean menores que las que obtenían antes. Sin embargo, la señora se ayuda con la venta de gallinas, ya que obtiene un buen precio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de  más mercancía, que le permitirá hacer frente a la época navideña en que las ventas se incrementan. Su meta es llegar a comprar un vehículo para poder vender su producto de una manera más fácil, sin tener que andar pagando a los buses para que le lleven la mercadería.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen, 59, is married and has two grown children. The children are married and have their own separate families. Maria buys and sells eggs and chickens. She is a street vendor in the Mercado Oriental of Managua. She started this business 14 years ago. She helped her mother, who originally had the business, sell. Later, she decided to become independent. She bought 300 cases of eggs and started to sell them in Managua. There is now a problem in that the price of eggs is very unstable. That means that each day her earnings are less than the day before. Nevertheless, she helps herself by selling chickens, and she gets a good price. The loan is to buy more merchandise, which will put her in front of the Christmas season as sales are increasing. Her goal is to buy a vehicle to be able to sell her product in an easier way without having to keep on paying the buses to carry her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ser-Od

texts.en: Ser-Od B. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in the Zavkhan Province of Western Mongolia. His wife works as a kindergarten teacher. His daughter and son, ages 13 and 11 respectively, attend a local secondary school. Ser-Od works as a carpenter. He has owned his carpentry business for almost 17 years and, over this long time, he has earned the loyalty of his customers because of the quality of his work and service. Ser-Od currently runs his business out of a rented space and would like to expand his product line in order to enlarge his customer base. He is requesting a 300,000 tugrug (approx. $211 USD) loan to purchase more timber for his growing business. XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more timber for his growing business

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail A. is single and has four children. She has received a senior-high education. Abigail sells cooked rice and fried plantains at Elmina near Dentedo, which she has been doing since 2000. Abigail uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. Abigail will use the loan to buy bags of rice and other foodstuff for the preparation of food for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abigail plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other foodstuff for the preparation of food for sale

loans.name: Byamba

texts.en:
Byamba C. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Uvurhangai province of central Mongolia. His daughter and son, 13 and 11, respectively, both attend a local secondary school, while his wife helps C. with the family clothing retail business. Currently, he rents space in a large market, but he is in the process of building their own retail space and should be finished by the end of the year. C. purchases clothing from China and resells it at his shop for a profit. He also operates a transportation business. C. is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug (approx. 2,780 USD) loan in order to purchase a large amount of winter clothing from China so that he can keep growing his clothing retail business.

C. is shown by his truck in the picture above.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of winter clothing from China so that he can keep growing his clothing retail business

loans.name: Sharavdorj

texts.en:
Sharavdorj D. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and three-year-old son in a house in the Govi-Altai province of southwest Mongolia. His wife is an accountant for a business center, his son attends a local kindergarten and D. operates his own raw material transportation service. He has had his business since 2007 and transports raw materials from Govi-Altai to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. On his return trips to Govi-Altai from Ulaanbaatar, he transports oil from the petrol company Magnai Trade or cargo from Narantuul, a large central market in the city. One day, D. would like to be able to purchase a larger truck in order to haul more materials to and from Ulaanbaatar. Now, however, he is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan so that he can purchase four new wheels for his trailer which he uses to haul materials.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase four new wheels for his trailer which he uses to haul materials

loans.name: Tserendash

texts.en:
Tserendash G. is 32 years old and lives with his mother in the Bayanhongor province of central Mongolia. G. works at the local gold mine during much of the year, but he also supplements his income by farming. In 2004, with the help of his mother, sister and brother-in-law, G. began planting vegetables on 0.2 hectares of land in the Bumbat of Ulziit soum. This year, he expanded his farmland to 1 hectare and hopes to continue growing in the future. Unfortunately, he won’t be able to grow as large or as fast as he wants to because he doesn’t have a storage building for his excess vegetables. Because of this problem, he is forced to sell some of the vegetables very cheaply and loses out on valuable profits. G. is requesting a 1,300,000 tugrug loan in order to build a storage facility that will enable him to increase the farming profits he and his family work so hard for.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To build a storage facility that will enable him to increase the farming profits he and his family work so hard for

loans.name: Lkhasuren

texts.en:
Lkhasuren T. is a 48-year-old hardworking businesswoman who lives with her husband and 2 children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. Her husband, Byambasuren, works as a welder, her daughter is a college student and her son attends a local high school. T. operates a dairy trade business at the local market in her town. She has operated this business since 1994 and has gained much experience over the years. Due to her hard work and good customer service practices, her business has grown steadily each year, and her working capital now exceeds 1,800,000 tugrugs. In addition, T.'s success has enabled her and her husband to enroll their children in good schools and have a quality life. For the future, she says, "My dream is to one day have my own store." T. is requesting a 2,800,000 tugrug loan to purchase more dairy products to sell.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi K. sells fresh fish at Elmina near Mpoble.  Esi has no educational background.  She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a fisherman. Esi has been selling fish since 2002. She helps her husband with the payments of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish to re-sell and also to be processed for sale at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish (and to-be-processed fish) to re-sell at the market.

loans.name: Menana

texts.en: Menana Y. sells smoked fresh fish at Elmina near Mpoble.  She has no educational background.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a fisherman. Menana has been selling fresh fish since 2002. She helps her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to sell. She also processes fish by smoking them and sells them at the market. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to sell and fish to smoke for sale at the market.

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en:
Amgalan E. is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Kharkhorin, the ancient capital of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Since 2000, E. has run a special order home furnishings carpentry business. In 2008, his wife began a canteen business close the the Erdenezuu monastery, a major tourist attraction in the city and a large gathering place for local Buddhists. The monastery canteen was successful so E. and his wife have decided to start another canteen at the local outdoor market in order to attract more customers. They are in the process of building a house near the local market so that they can be closer to their second business. E. says, “My dream is to build a warm, comfortable house for my family from my business profits.” He is requesting a loan of 500,000 tugrugs (approx. $338 USD) in order to complete the construction of their home near the market. XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To complete the construction of their home near the market

loans.name: Gonchigsuren

texts.en:
Gonchigsuren E. attended a felt souvenirs training seminar with three friends in 2005, and they decided to begin their own business. Most of her products are sold to foreign tourists, but some are bought by local Mongolians. Since then, her business has grown steadily and her working capital has increased from 200,000 tugriks (~ $140 US) to 2,300,000 tugriks (~ $1,614 US). She credits her business success to her hard work and good customer service. She is requesting a 2,300,000 tugrik loan in order to purchase more wool felt and to increase her working capital to prepare for next year’s tourist season.

E. is 41 years old and lives with her 10-year-old daughter in the Arhangai province of central Mongolia. She and her daughter live together, and her daughter attends a local secondary school. Because of her business success, E. was able to purchase a house with a yard where she can raise her daughter in relative comfort.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more wool felt

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 31 years old. He is married and has two sons. He has a retail shop and has been in business for three years. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy milk, omo (soap powder), salt, Royco food items, cooking fat, and other items.

Martin says that, although he is a new Faulu client, he is determined to improve his business with this loan. In the future, he would like to be a supplier of shop items and have a supermarket. He dreams of becoming a prosperous businessman who is able to meet the needs of his customers and his family. He describes himself as very hardworking. He wants to improve his own life and the lives of the people around him.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Dorjsuren

texts.en: Dorjsuren O. is 21 years old and lives with his wife and one-year-old daughter in a house in the Tosontsengel Province of Central Mongolia. His wife works as a bank teller. O. operates a raw-material retail business in his town. He started his business in 2006 with the help of his older brother. After lots of hard work and determination, O. operates his business independently. He purchases skins and wool from herders and sells them for a profit in the Central Market. One day, O. hopes to have his own store where his customers and suppliers can come to him. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (approx. $1381 USD) loan to purchase livestock skins that he will sell in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city, and to buy a car for his family. XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase livestock skins to sell, and a car for his family

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. She sells household items like basins, thermos flasks, kitchen trays, trolleys, plates, cups, knives, and spoons, among other products, in her stall. She has been in this business for three years. Alice earns extra income by supplying food, such as maize, to schools and hospitals. 

She is requesting for a loan of Kes. 45,000 to add more maize, utensils and shoes to her inventory. She says that her business has grown since joining Faulu, and she hopes to expand her business further and acquire land. She describes herself as hardworking, innovative and informed.

loans.use: Buy products for her inventory

loans.name: Virgen Estrella De Oropesa Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Virgen Estrella D. Oropesa, are clients of Asociación Arariwa.  This communal bank consists of 14 members in Oropesa, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. All the group members live in Oropesa.  There is only one man in the group but he feels right at home with these strong hard-working ladies.  They all have a great sense of humor.

The president of the group, Tania Gladys, was born in in Quillabamba and is 53 years old and lives in Oropesa.  She is married and lives with her spouse and 2 children.  She has been selling bread for the last 9 years.  She will use this loan to buy more supplies for her bakery - flour, butter, sugar, etc. 

Most of the members are involved in making a special type of bread called “chuta”. Oropesa is the bread-making capital of the Cusco area.  Walking down the streets, the smell of bread permeates the air.  With this loan, most of the group members will grow their panaderías, or bakeries, buying flour, sugar, and butter to make and sell more bread.  

Some of the members also make chicha (a Peruivan drink maD. from corn) and will use the loan to buy more corn.  Some raise cuy (guinea pigs) and will use the loan for food and medicines for their animals.

All of the members appreciate and thank you for the loan and promise to pay the monthly payments on time.

(EDY MARLENY is not pictured in the photo)

loans.use: Breadmaking supplies

loans.name: Nijat

texts.en:
Nijat M. has a successful business selling food at a market in a village in Imishli. He started his business about 10 years ago after evaluating different business possibilities and deciding this would be the best option and something he would enjoy. 

Nijat purchases products at very low prices and then resells them for a profit. Because he sells in bulk, he deals with a high inventory turnover rate. Nijat rents a very good location at the market for his business and he has little competition. 

He has requested a loan of 1606 AZN to increase his business capital. This loan will enable him to buy more produce to sell, so he can increase his profits and continue to operate a profitable business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Vitaliano

texts.en:
Vitaliano is 43 years old and has been married for 20 years. He and his wife have six children, ages 19, 17, 15, 13, 10, and 8. Vitaliano's father died when he was young, so he began helping his mother on their farm. As a result, he never finished primary school and hardly knows how to read or write. Like many dairy cow farmers in the area, he learned farming by helping his parents when he was a child. Vitaliano is a dairy cow farmer who produces and sells milk but, at the moment, they have only three dairy cows. Vitaliano and his family live in a small and humble home in Quillacollo, a large suburb of the city of Cochabamba. 

With this loan from CIDRE, Vitaliano will purchase another dairy cow to augment his milk production. He hopes to increase his earnings and improve his family's quality of life. Vitaliano would like to construct a new home for his family and hopes that his five younger children will be able to study to become professionals. His oldest daughter could not continue her studies because Vitaliano and his wife lacked the financing necessary to pay for her education at the time, so she only studied through primary school and is currently working in Argentina.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Aybeniz

texts.en:
Aybeniz A. is a very hardworking and independent woman. She has three children, two of whom are in elementary school and high school, and still require her support. In search of a way to support her household, she started selling groceries 8 years ago. A true entrepreneur, she studies the market to determine client needs and preferences. Industrious and enterprising, Aybeniz is focused on expanding her business. 

Aybeniz is requesting a loan of 1606 AZN that she will use to purchase food, so she can offer a wider selection to her customers and increase her income. With the increased sales and profits, Aybeniz hopes to expand her grocery and improve the living standards of her family. The well being of Aybeniz’s family and her business are in your hands. Aybeniz and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Seminia Irayda

texts.en:
Seminia is 26 years old and has been married for 10 years.  She and her husband have two children, ages 8 and 3 years old.  Seminia is a cattle farmer. She has 8 dairy cows that produce raw milk. Seminia turns the milk into soft cheese and yogurt, which she sells every day in the market beginning at 6 a.m. She learned dairy cow farming by helping her mother when she was a young girl. She lives at home with her mother in the Maica Central area of the city of Cochabamba.  

Seminia married very young, so she had to begin working from a young age to support her new family. Because her family has scarce economic resources, they do not yet have their own home. 

With this loan from CIDRE, Seminia will purchase another dairy cow. This will increase her milk production and improve her earnings and, ultimately, improve her family's quality of life. She dreams that some day her children will finish their primary and secondary education and that they can go on to become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa is 47 years old and has been married for 15 years. She and her husband have two children, ages 17 and 15. Nicolasa is a dairy cow farmer. She uses the raw milk to make cheese, and then sells the cheese in the market. She learned dairy cow farming from her mother when she was a little girl.  Nicolasa and her family have a small home in Maica Norte, an area just outside of the city of Cochabamba.  This is where her six dairy cows are located.

Currently, Nicolasa's husband is working in Spain, so she has been taking care of the business herself. He has been sending his earnings back to the family, so she has been remodeling their home with the extra income. Recently, however, due to the economic crisis, he has not been able to contribute as much. Her oldest child is studying to become an auditor and she is in her second semester of studies.

With this loan from CIDRE, Nicolasa plans to purchase one more dairy cow. This will help her to increase her level of milk production incrementally.  Nicolasa's dream is for her husband to return from Spain that they can work together in Bolivia and they don't have to be separated anymore.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Heraclia

texts.en:
Heradia has been married for 20 years. She is 46 years old and has three children. 

Heradia sells groceries. Also, along with her husband, she transport passengers and cargo in her family's large truck. She began selling groceries in San Pedro market eight years ago, and she is still selling there today. Heradia began working when she was a little girl in Potosi and moved to the municipality of Buena Vista, Cochabamba when she became an adult. She travels with her husband when he transports cargo and passengers in his truck.

Heradia plans to use this loan to purchase more merchandise for her grocery business in the San Pedro D. Buena Vista market. Providing more merchandise will help Heradia to increase her earnings so that she can remodel her home and fund her childrens' studies. Her two oldest children are currently finishing high school. Heredia hopes she will be able to offer her youngest child, who is just one year old, a very comfortable future, and she hopes that he can always be able to rely on her.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery stall in market

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Sona M.'s business involves purchasing and reselling sheep with her husband. She is 49 years old and married with four children. She has requested a loan of 1606 Azerbaijani manats in order to purchase additional sheep to meet customer demand. Sona believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional sheep and further increase their income to aid her children's education. You can become an important part in the life of Sona and her family. She deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Fakhriyya

texts.en:
Fakhriyya L. is 33 years old. She sells perfume and cosmetics in the store that she rents. She has been in this business for nine years. Fakhriyya is dreaming of expanding her business, opening her own store and establishing contacts with the constant suppliers of well-known producers. 

Today she requests 1606 AZN in order to purchase new perfumes and cosmetics, such as hair color, nail varnish and lipstick, with the purpose of increasing the range of her goods. Fakhriyya would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase new perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Edil German

texts.es:
Edil  vive en la calle  “Simon Bolivar” de la zona  Porvenir de la ciudad de El Alto

Vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo en unas habitaciones en alquiler.
Su esposa  se dedica a la costura de ropa deportiva. 

El trabaja como chofer de un minibus  en las rutas de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de una maquina de costura para que su esposa pueda realizar trabajos y así colaborar en los ingresos de su joven familia.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Edil lives on Simon Bolivar Street, in the Porvenir district of the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and his young child in rental housing. His wife is a sportswear seamstress. He works as a minibus driver on the city routes of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy a sewing machine for his wife, so that she can get work and, in this way share in the young family’s earnings. This is the first loan with Impro. which evaluated and approved him for granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 44-year-old married father of two children. For the past four years, he has run a Jua Kali shop (an informal store, sometimes consisting of goods spread out on a blanket on the ground). He sells mali mali (household goods), including blankets, rubber shoes and baby clothing. He also works as a taxi driver to earn extra income. 

Francis says that since joining Faulu, a Kiva partner, he has been able to meet his financial obligations, pay for his children to attend a better school and buy some assets. He would like to expand his business to become a wholesale supplier and move to a better premises. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Hernan Henry

texts.es:
Hernan  vive en la calle  “29” de la zona  Rosas Pampa de la ciudad de El Alto

Vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, en la casa de sus familiares. 

Hernan posee un automóvil con el cual trabaja como chofer  de una línea de trufis en la ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la reparación del motor de su movilidad, ya que  actualmente presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo completas. 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Hernan lives in the Rosas Pampa area of the city of El Alto, on street 29. He lives with his wife and his children, who are of school age, in his family's home. He has a car with which he works as a chauffeur with taxi line in the city. The loan will be used to repair the motor of his car, because he currently is experiencing mechanical problems that prevents him from working full time. This is his second loan with Impro, and his evaluation qualified him to be given the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of the motor of his vehicle

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 34 years old and married with two daughters, aged 9 and 3. He runs a boda boda (motorbike) taxi business in Kitengela, a small town near Nairobi. He has operated his business for two years and has three employees. He supplements his income with a milk-supply business and previously sold cereals. He is requesting a loan for 40,000 Kenyan shillings to add another motorbike to the business. 

Peter describes himself as optimistic, hardworking and self-driven and hopes to expand his business with more motorbikes and a trailer for transport.

loans.use: Buy another motorbike

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio  vive en la calle  “Teniente Delgadillo” de la zona  Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive con su esposa, la cual se dedica al cuidado de su hogar, en dos habitaciones, las cuales se encuentran en alquiler.
 
Ignacio posee un automóvil con el cual trabaja como chofer  de una línea de trufis en la ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinará para aumento de capital para la compra de un vehiculo de  modelo mas reciente y realizar la venta del que actualmente posee.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Ignacio lives in the city of La Paz, in the Achachicala neighborhood, on Teniente Delgadillo street. He lives with his wife, who takes care of the 2 bedroom home that they rent. Ignacio has a car with which he works as a chauffeur in a taxi line in the city. The loan will be used to increase his capital so that he can buy a newer car model and be able to sell his current vehicle. This is his first loan with Impro, and the evaluation completed deemed him qualified to be given the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a vehicle

loans.name: Dorscilah

texts.en:
Dorscilah has a food kiosk in which she sells foodstuffs and tea and other drinks. She is 33 years old and married with four children between the ages of 4 and 17. She has been in business for 15 years and says her kiosk is sustainable. She is now requesting 20,000 Kenyan shillings to expand her business by adding inventory of cereals.

Thanks to Faulu's teachings, Dorscilah says she has become a visionary lady. She also describes herself as hardworking and hopes to grow her business to comfortably provide for her family, herself and her business.

loans.use: To add stock of cereals

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel  vive en la calle  “Illampu” de la zona 21 de diciembre de la ciudad de El Alto

Vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, en la casa de sus familiares, como cuidador con opción a compra.

Angel posee un minibus el cual trabaja como chofer propietario en rutas de la ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinará para el cambio de motor de su vehiculo, ya que  actualmente presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo normales. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Angel lives on Illampu Street in the 21 de diciembre zone of El Alto. He lives with his wife and children, all of school age, in his relatives’ home as a caretaker, with the option of purchasing it. Angel drives a minibus, which he owns, along various routes in the city. He will use his loan to change the motor in his bus, as currently it’s failing and preventing him from completing his usual work commute. This is his first loan with Impro, as he passed the evaluation required to qualify for him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs to the motor in his vehicle

loans.name: Samwuel

texts.en:
Samwuel is 46 years old and married with five children. He sells charcoal in the Mathare slums and employs one person. He's been in business for 13 years and has successfully completed several previous loans. He also runs a photography business and has his own studio. He is now requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy charcoal worth Kes. 40,000 and film and batteries for his photography studio.

In the future, Samuel hopes to set up a distribution centre for charcoal in the area and invest in a car to transport charcoal from the source. He would also like to own a home. He describes himself as persevering, hardworking, and goal-oriented and says that loans from Faulu have kept his business productive enough to feed his family.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, film and batteries

loans.name: Angel Fernando

texts.es:
Angel  vive en la calle “ Vega ”  de la zona Villa Dolores en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en casa propia,  junto a su esposa la cual es comerciante en un mercado de la zona  y  sus dos hijos menores.
 
Trabaja como maestro carpintero en su taller ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de madera al por mayor, ya que para su trabajo requiere que el material este relativamente seco.
 
Es el   octavo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Angel lives on Vega Street in the Villa Dolores zone of El Alto city. He lives in his own house with his wife and two children. She is a merchant in the public market. He works as a master carpenter with his own shop, located in the center of the city of La Paz.

The loan is destined for the acquisition of wood at wholesale. For his work the material must be relatively dry. This is his 8th loan from IMPRO. The evaluation carried out shows him to be qualified to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY WOOD FOR HIS CARPENTER SHOP

loans.name: Fatima Ii Group

texts.es: El grupo “Fátima II” esta representado por la señora  Elsa y conformado por 15 miembros los cuales realizan diferentes actividades para el sustento D. sus familias como la venta D. artículos D. la canasta familiar en pequeñas pulperías, venta  D. comida al paso, refrigerios,  servicio  D. moto taxi, venta D. cosméticos  y el servicio mecánico. Dentro del ámbito comercial y D. servicios el nivel competitivo es alto en especial para los socios que tienen poca mercadería  y no pueden competir con las grandes tiendas  que pueden abaratar sus costos y seguir en la competencia, pero las socias tienen mucha experiencia y ganas D. trabajar con el incentivo D. sacar adelante a sus familias que es el impulso para salir adelante. El destino del préstamo es para incrementar su mercadería así como la compra D. insumos y materiales que ayuden a obtener un mejor capital D. trabajo para hacer frente a la competencia. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo por lo que no tienen mucha experiencia en grupos solidarios pero tienen muchos deseos D. crecer y este deseo les impulsa a seguir adelante para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The “Fátima II” Group is represented by Elsa and is comprised of 15 members who support their families in different ways such as selling basic foods at small local stores, selling street food, selling snacks, moto-taxi [motorcycle with attached cab for passengers] service, cosmetics sales, and mechanic service. In the world of commerce and services there is a high level of competition, especially for those who don't have much merchandise and can't compete with the large stores that can reduce their costs and stay competitive. But the members of the “Fátima II” Group have a great desire to work, with the incentive of providing for their families which is their motive for trying to get ahead. This loan is to be used to increase their merchandise supply as well as to buy food and materials that will help them get better working capital in order to take on the competition. As far as experience, the members are going through their first cycle, so don't have much experience in community banks, but they have many hopes of growing and this is what drives them to keep going forward to proviD. their families with the best quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, KI. Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
Evaristo vive en la calle  San Miguel de la zona  Villa cooperativa de la ciudad de La Paz

Vive junto a sus dos hijos menores, los cuales están en edad escolar, pues sus otros hijos ya tienen su propia familia y son independientes. 

Trabaja  de empleado en un taller, como artesano, en la elaboración de moldes de zapatos, ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de materiales de construcción necesarios para levantar un muro en la casa donde vive.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Evaristo lives on San Miguel Street in the Villa Cooperativa district of the city of La Paz. He lives with his two dependent children who attend school. He has other adult children who have their own families.

Evaristo is an employee at a workshop in La Paz, where he works as a craftsman. He makes shoe molds.

The funds will be used to purchase the necessary construction materials to build a wall around his house. This is Evaristo’s second loan with IMPRO and his evaluation indicates he qualified for approval.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a wall around his house

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: El grupo “Primavera” esta representada por la señora Norah y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a al venta D. comida, pacumutu,  abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, cosméticos, chicharrones, verduras, venta D. mantas y mandiles y también a la costura y confección D. prendas D. vestir.  Dentro del ámbito comercial y D. servicios el nivel competitivo es alto en especial para los socios que tienen poca mercadería  y no pueden competir con las grandes tiendas  que pueden abaratar sus costos y seguir en la competencia, pero las socias tienen mucha experiencia y ganas D. trabajar con el incentivo D. sacar adelante a sus familias que es el impulso para salir adelante. El destino del préstamo es para incrementar su mercadería así como la compra D. insumos y materiales que ayuden a obtener un mejor capital D. trabajo para hacer frente a la competencia. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo por lo que no tienen mucha experiencia en grupos solidarios pero tienen muchos deseos D. crecer y este deseo les impulsa a seguir adelante para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The Primavera (“Spring”) Group is led by Sra. Norah and consists of 12 members who are engaged in various retail business selling food, skewered meats, groceries, cosmetics, fried pork rinds, vegetables, blankets, aprons, and handmaD. apparel. The level of competition is high within the business environment, but the members are experienced and willing to work hard because they want to succeed for the sake of their families' welfare. Their loans will be used to acquire merchandise to increase their inventory as well as purchase materials and supplies that will help them stay ahead of the competition.

The group is starting its first loan cycle, so they have little experience working as part of a solidarity group. However, they are eager to grow and desire to proviD. their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Antonio Luis

texts.es: El señor Antonio vive con su esposa la SrA. Asunta, y sus hijos de 17 y 15 años. Viven en anticrético en la zona de Huayra Kasa. Los clientes se dedican a prestar servicios de pintado de interiores y exteriores. El señor Antonio trabaja por su parte en dicho rubro y la señora al haber aprendido la actividad realiza sus propios contratos de manera independiente. Son muy cotizados en su rubro. Pese a que en esta actividad tienen bastante competencia, ellos son bastante cotizados en su rubro y tienen buena clientela que contactan a través de tienda de venta de pinturas. El crédito fue destinado para algunos gastos de consumo, por las fiestas de TODOS LOS SANTOS (día de los muertos). El Sr. Antonio trabaja desde hace mucho tiempo con nuestra institución y es considerado buen cliente ya que realiza sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
Sr. Antonio lives with his wife, Sra. Asunta, and their two children (ages 17 and 15). They live in a rental property in the district of Huayra Kasa. These clients provide interior and exterior painting services. Sr. Antonio does the actual painting while his wife manages the business activities since he works as an independent contractor. Their services are in great demand in the area. Although there is significant competition, their services are fairly priced and they have a good clientele who contact them whenever they need rooms painted.

This loan will be used to pay for some consumer expenses related to the All Saints Day festivals (Día de los Muertos, or Day of the Dead). Sr. Antonio has been with our Institution for a long time and is considered a good client who has been punctual with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Consumer expenses

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis vive en la calle  “Tacaya” de la zona  Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto, en una casa como cuidador.

Luis posee un terreno donde pocp a poco está construyendo su casa.
 
Vive junto a sus dos hijos menores, los cuales están en edad escolar, pues sus otros hijos, son mayores,   ya tienen su propia familia y son independientes. 

El trabaja como contratista en trabajos de decorado y pintado de viviendas, los cuales los realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de materiales de construcción (arena, cemento, ladrillos) para continuar edificando su casa.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Luis lives on Tacaya Street in the Villa Ingenio zone of El Alto city. He resides in a house as a caretaker. Luis owns land on which, little by little, he is building his own house. He lives with his two minor children, who are of school age. His other children, already adults, are independent and have their own families. The loan is destined for buying construction materials (sand, cement, bricks) to continue building his house. This is his first credit with IMPRO. The evaluation carried out qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS FOR CONSTRUCTING WALLS FOR HIS HOUSE

loans.name: Cañaveral Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Cañaveral” esta representada por la señora Sonia  y conformada por 13 miembros en su mayoría mujeres bien trabajadoras y emprendedoras como lo demuestran en su puestos D. trabajo, cada una D. ellas se dedica a  diferentes actividades D. tipo comercial como la venta y confección D. prendas D. vestir, venta  D. comida, refrigerios,  servicio D. trasporte, servicio D. construcción  y gaseosas.  Dentro del ámbito comercial y D. servicios el nivel competitivo es alto en especial para los socios que tienen poca mercadería  y no pueden competir con las grandes tiendas  que pueden abaratar sus costos y seguir en la competencia, pero las socias tienen mucha experiencia y ganas D. trabajar con el incentivo D. sacar adelante a sus familias que es su impulso para salir adelante. El destino del préstamo es para incrementar su mercadería así como la compra D. insumos y materiales que ayuden a obtener un mejor capital D. trabajo para hacer frente a la competencia. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo por lo que no tienen mucha experiencia en grupos solidarios pero tienen muchos deseos D. crecer y este deseo les impulsa a seguir adelante para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia is the communal bank “Cañaveral’s” representative. The bank has 13 members who are mostly hard working entrepreneurial women whose jobs demonstrate this. Each woman works in a different type of commercial business like seamstress, food sales, refreshments, transportation services, construction, and the sale of soft drinks. In the field of goods and services, competition is high and in particular for those members who do not have much merchandise. They cannot compete with the bigger stores that can lower their costs and still remain competitive. However, the bank's members have a lot of experience and are motivated by a desire to help their families get ahead. The loan is to increase merchandise. For example, to purchase supplies and materials that can help them get better working capital so they can stand up to the competition. This is the bank members first loan cycle, so they do not have much experience in solidarity groups, but they do have a great desire to grow. This desire pushes them to get ahead to proviD. their families with a higher quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, KI. Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Eco Andino Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, “Alto Lima” se encuentra una de las Asociaciones antiguas de Pro Mujer “Eco Andino”, con aproximadamente 14 años de vida, cuenta con 12 integrantes. Su presidenta es Albertina Y. que se dedica a la artesanía confeccionando presentes nativos como llama, casina, pueblo y otros  en bastidores o telares, cuenta que inicio su negocio hace aproximadamente 20 años pero en los últimos años ha bajado su producción porque no encuentra mercado donde acomodar sus productos, entonces está solicitando es un monto bajo y en esta oportunidad necesita el préstamo para comprar lana, a futuro ella quiere cambiar de negocio. Las demás integrantes del grupo tambien tienen diferententes negocios como la venta de verduras, api, atención de tienda, confección de ropa y tejido de chompa. Necesitan el préstamo  para comprar insumos, materia prima y mercadería.
texts.en:
In Pro Mujer's Focal Center "Alto Lima", one of its older groups "Eco Andino" is found. It has been in existence for approximately 14 years and has 12 members. Its president is Albertina Y. who makes traditional handicrafts featuring scenes of villages, llamas, etc., on a loom or frame. She says that she started her business about 20 years ago but in recent years her production has decreased because she isn't able to find a market in which to put up her products. So she is requesting a small loan to buy wool. In the future she would like to change businesses. The rest of the members of the group also have different businesses such as selling vegetables, running a store, clothes making, and sweater making. They need the loan to purchase foods, raw materials, and merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase foods, raw materials, and merchandise

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora has been married for 23 years. She is 48 years old and she has two children.  She works as a dairy cow farmer and sells the milk that her cows produce to Pil, a large local dairy company.  She learned dairy farming over 27 years ago when she worked alongsiD. her parents.

With this loan, Leonora plans to purchase chopped cornhusk to feed her cattle.  This investment is very important as Cochabamba has been suffering from a major drought and the prices of livestock feed have skyrocketed.  Leonora's main goal is to continue funding both of her children's education.  Her older son is studying agriculture at the university and will help her run the farm when he finishes.  Her younger son spends his mornings helping Leonora on the farm and goes to school in the afternoons.

loans.use: To purchase feed for livestock

loans.name: Roxana Patricia

texts.es:
Roxana vive en el “Manzano D”  de la zona Rio Seco en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Por circunstancias de la vida la señora se quedo como madre y padre, de su hijo de 17 años de edad, el cual cursa los últimos años de secundaria.
 
Trabaja como comerciante en la venta de comida al paso en un céntrico parque de la zona.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de material para la construcción de un muro perimetral de su terreno.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Roxana lives in Manzano D in the Rio Seco zone of El Alto. Life circumstances have forced her to be both mother and father to her 17-year old son, who is in the process of finishing high school. She works as a food vendor in a park in the center of her neighborhood. She will use the loan to build a wall around the perimeter of the property on which she lives. This is her first loan with Impro; her evaluation has qualified her to receive it.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contruction of a wall around her property

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Como segunda actividad se dedica al cultivo de papa y otros, en su respectiva comunidad, su esposa es ama de casa y colabora con el cuidado del ganando.


Vive. en la  comunidad  de Ticuyo de la Provincia  los Andes  del departamento de La Paz, ubicado  a  dos  horas de la ciudad de La Paz.


El crédito lo destinará a la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Luis raises cattle and sells the milk to PIL Andina (leading milk supplier in Bolivia). As a second activity he grows potatoes in his community. His wife is a housewife and helps take care of the cattle. He lives in Ticuyo, in the Los Andes province located two hours away from La Paz. He will use his loan to purchase a dairy cow and increase his production, thus increasing his income. This is his first loan with Impro; his evaluation has qualified him to receive it.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: El Gran Paititi Group

texts.es: El Grupo “El gran Paititi II” esta representado por la señora Ninoska y conformado por 15 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades de índole comercial y de servicios como la venta de abarrotes en pulperías o en tiendas de barrio, venta de cosméticos y perfumes, masitas, ropa y comidas. Dentro del ámbito comercial las socias cuentan con una gran competencia pero saben como salir adelante para forjar un mejor futuro para sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es específicamente para incrementar su mercadería y para agrandar sus fuentes de trabajo. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los integrantes del grupo ya tenían experiencia en otras instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital, pero están agradecidos por el gran apoyo económico y la confianza otorgada por nuestra institución ya que de ello depende el futuro de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Group “El gran Paititi II” is represented by Mrs. Ninoska and made up of 15 members, all of whom are involved in various commercial activities and services, such as selling groceries in a grocery or neighborhood store, cosmetics and perfume sales, dough making, sales of clothing, and food. There is a lot of competition in commerce but the members know how to forge ahead in order to create a better future for their families. This loan will be used specifically to increase their various merchandise and their incomes. As far as their credit history goes, the members of this group all have experience with lending institutions similar to Fundacíon Agrocapital, however, they are still grateful for the great economic support and confidence our institution can provide for them, as the future of their families depends on it.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda se dedica a la elaboración de masitas, y también cocina comida, recibiendo contratos en eventos de fiestas
Vive en la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de harina, azúcar y demás insumos)
Es la octava vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Nilda is a dough maker and a caterer who is hired for events and parties. She lives in the Tembladerani zone of Cuidad de La Paz, in her parents home. She will use the loan for working capital (purchasing flour, sugar and other ingredients). This is her eighth loan from Impro; her history has qualified her as a premier customer, meaning she has satisfactorily paid off all her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Carmen” esta representado por la señora Erika y conformada por 13 miembros los cuales realizan diferentes actividades como la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo, venta D. tarjetas para celulares, atención en fotocopiadora, elaboración y venta D. pan D. Arroz, venta D. ropa y zapatos, venta D. leña y atención en salón D. belleza.  En cuanto a la competencia es alto en su ámbito D. trabajo, por lo que las socias ven la necesidad D. mayor capital para poder competir en el mercado esta es una D. las razones por las que desean el finaciamiento para poder adquirir mayor mercadería, insumos y herramientas para poder crecer y llegar a su segunda razón que es su familia y el bien estar D. la misma. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los integrantes del grupo ya tenían experiencia en otras instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital, pero están agradecidos por el gran apoyo económico y la confianza otorgada por nuestra institución ya que D. ello depenD. el futuro D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “El Carmen” is represented by Erika and maD. up of 13 members who carry out different activities such as selling cosmetics by catalogue, mobile phone cards, photocopying, making and selling rice bread, selling clothes, shoes and firewood and assisting customers in a beauty salon. The competition is very high in their field of work, which is why the group´s members acknowledge the necessity to increase their working capital so they can compete in the market. This is one of the reasons why they are applying for a loan so that they can purchase more merchandise, supplies and tools to increase their business, the other being to contribute to the wellbeing of their family. The group already have experience taking out loans in other similar institutions to Fundación Agrocapital. They are grateful for the great economic support and trust which has been granted to them by this institution, as the future of their families depends on it.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: 25 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
El grupo “25 D. Agosto” esta representado por la señora Mary Luz y conformado por 12 miembros, son personas muy activas y con ganas D. trabajar para salir adelante en cada uno D. sus negocios por ejemplo la presidenta se dedica a  la elaboración y distribución D. pan empezando a trabajar desD. muy tempranas horas D. la mañana; al igual que ella el resto D. las integrantes del grupo son muy dedicadas a su trabajo ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. En general las socias se dedican a la venta D. comida, cosméticos y golosinas. Dentro del ámbito D. venta D. comida existe mucha competencia pero lo importante en este negocio es el sabor D. la comida, es por esta razón que requieren del préstamo para ampliar sus puestos D. ventas D. comida y para la adquisición D. insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mejor ingreso para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. Un 70% D. las socias ya  cuentan con experiencia en grupo solidarios pero están muy satisfechas con el apoyo que les brinda la fundación Agrocapital que creen en el grupo para salir adelante.
Capital D. Operaciones
texts.en:
The group “25 D. Agosto” (25th of August) is represented by Mary Luz and maD. up of 12 members, all of whom are active people with the desire to work to get ahead in each of their businesses. For example, the group's president makes and distributes bread, beginning work in the early hours of the morning. Just like her, the rest of the group's members are very dedicated to their work, as they have to be since their families' upkeep depends on it. In general the group sells food, cosmetics and sweets. There is a lot of competition in the field of food sales but the most important thing in this business is the taste of the food, which is why the group require a loan to extend their food sales outlets and to purchase the supplies and tools that will help to generate more income and in turn improve their families' quality of life. 70% of the group's members already have experience in community groups and are very satisfied with the support that the Agrocapital foundation offers them and their faith in the group to move forward. The group plan to use the loan for working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Luis David

texts.es:
Luís, trabaja en una oficina como mensajero y estudia en el instituto bancario, es independiente y el único que genera ingresos pasa solventar sus gastos.
Vive en la zona de Chasquipampa  de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para capital de Inversión ( pago de mensualidades y matricula en el instituto bancario, y así mejorar sus condiciones laborales). 
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Luís works in an office as a courier and studies in a banking institute. He is independent and pays his bills from his own income. He lives with his parents in the Chasquipampa zone in the city of La Paz. The loan he is applying for will be used for investment capital (to cover monthly payments and banking institute fees, which is how he will improve his working conditions). This is the first time he is requesting a loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Virgen De Cotoca Group

texts.es: El grupo “Virgen de Cotoca” esta representado por la señora Carolina y conformada por 12 miembros muy dinámicas puesto que desean realizar actividades para confraternizar y unirse mas como grupo; las señoras tienen una amistad desde hace mucho tiempo y son vecinas del barrio. desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades comerciales y de servicio como la atención en salones de belleza, tienda de abarrotes, venta de comida y venta de cosméticos  y en cuanto al socio tiene una venta de abarrotes y cuando hay conciertos de artistas vende refrescos en el lugar de actuación la señora Carolina tiene su venta de refrescos ella desea diversificar sus productos, la mayoría de las socias tiene sus puestos de venta en la puerta de sus hogares y el resto son vendedoras ambulantes a  pesar de las adversidades la socias saben como salir adelante ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que es alto pero cuando la competencia los perjudica mueven sus puestos a lugares más alejados del mercado central consiguiendo mejores ventas. El destino del financiamiento es para surtir sus tiendas, compra de material de trabajo, compra de insumos en mayor cantidad y las promotoras de cosméticos aprovecharon las ofertas. Su mayor expectativa es agrandar sus puestos para generar un mejor ingreso para poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida para todas sus familias. A pesar de ser su primer ciclo los socios ya cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a entidades financieras similares a la Fundación Agocapital con la cual se encuentran agradecidos por la confianza y el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en:
The “Virgen de Cotoca” Group, represented by Ms. Carolina, is comprised of 12 very dynamic members who wish to participate in activities together to fraternize and become more unified as a group. As they are neighbors, the women have had a friendship for a very long time. They all partake in various commercial and service activities, such as beauty salons, general stores, food sales, and cosmetics. One member has a general store, and when there are concerts in the area, he sells beverages at the venue. Ms. Carolina has her own beverage business, but would like to diversify her products. The majority of group members have stands in front of their homes, and the rest are street vendors. Despite all the adversities that they face, they know how to get ahead because their families depend on it. Concerning competition, we can say that it is high, but when it gets too tough, the group members simply move their stands away from the central market, thus boosting their sales. This loan will be used to restock their shops, purchase work materials and supplies in bulk, and the members who sell cosmetics will take advantage of the ongoing sales. Their greatest hope is to expand their stands to generate greater revenues so that they can offer their children a better future and quality of life. Despite the fact that this is their first loan cycle, the group members already have previous experience working in solidarity groups thanks to financial institutes similar to Fundación Agocapital, to which they are very grateful for their trust and monetary support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: 21 De Enero Group

texts.es: El grupo "21 D. Enero" esta representado por la señora Marianela y conformada por 12 socias D. las cuales un 50 % son profesionales que desarrollan actividades comerciales como la venta D. ropa juvenil, perfumes, joyas, una D. las socia tiene su salón D. belleza y el socio participante venD. productos varios al por mayor, es un buen vendedor porque cortantemente está en contacto con sus clientes para no perder su mercado D. venta, la presidenta venD. joyas D. plata y joyas bañadas en oro, es una buena vendedora ya que las joyas las venD. a crédito  o al contado; todas se conocen hace tiempo y tienen una estima muy especial entre ellas, tienen muchas expectativas para el futuro D. mejorar y seguir creciendo más cada día por el bien D. sus familias. En el ámbito comercial la competencia es alta, pero año tras año las socias luchan para tener un ingreso diario que sustente a su familia. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mayor mercadería para ampliar sus tiendas y también para la compra D. puestos fijos. . A pesar D. ser su primer ciclo los socios ya cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a entidades financieras similares a la Fundación Agocapital con la cual se encuentran agradecidos por la confianza y el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en:
The group "21 D. Enero" (January 21st) has twelve members and is represented by Sra. Marianela. Fifty percent of the members are merchants selling children clothes, perfumes and jewelry. One of the members has a beauty salon. Another member sells different wholesale products. He is in constant contact with his clients in order not to lose his market; he is a great salesperson. The group’s president sells silver and gold plated jewelry. She gives her clients the option to pay by cash or in installments; she is a great businesswoman. They have all known each other for a long time and have a special affection towards each other. For the sake of their families’ future, they have high expectations for the future growth of their businesses.
There is high competition in their businesses, but year after year the group members have worked hard to ensure they sell enough to support their families.
This loan will be used to buy merchandise to expand their businesses and to buy a retail space. Although this is their first loan, they have a lot of experience with other communal banks thanks to other financial institutions similar to Fundación AgroCapital. They are thankful for the trust and financial support that Fundacion AgroCapital has given them.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Bertha Carmelina

texts.es: Bertha Carmelina, de 43 años de edad,  tiene 6 hijos, 4 mayores de edad y 2 menores de edad, 4 de sus hijas le ayudan  atender su comedor, doña bertha en sus tiempos libres se dedica a confeccionar trajes, que es de lo que siempre a sacado adelante a sus hijas, ella necesita  un crédito de                       Q 9,000.00, para invertir en su comedor y cafetería, ya que en estos meses ella tiene varios pedidos de comida , su sueño es ver a todos sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Bertha Carmelina, age 43, has 6 children—2 adults and 2 minors. Four of her daughters help her out with her small restaurant. Ms. Bertha also makes clothing during her spare time. With these two businesses, she has always managed to help her children get ahead in life. She needs a 9,000 GTQ loan to invest in her eatery because she has had several food orders these past few months. Her dream is to see all her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant

loans.name: Miriam Marlene

texts.es:
Miriam trabaja vendiendo productos de Herbalife, es madre soltera y la única que genera ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares
Vive en la zona Achumani de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de batidos, vitaminas y productos de nutrición)
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su responsabilidad y la necesidad que tiene le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Miriam works selling Herbalife products. She is a single mother and the sole breadwinner in her household.

She lives in her parents’ house in the Achumani zone of the City of La Paz. This loan will be used as working capital to purchase shakes, vitamins, and other nutritional products.

This is the first time that she requests a loan from Impro. Her responsibility and her necessity give her the opportunity to obtain this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Pioneras De Chijini De Rsr Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Pioneras D. Chijini” están representadas por la señora Elsa y conformada por 13 miembros que van cursando juntas ya su segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos, todas son personas muy trabajadoras y honestas por ejemplo la presidenta es muy proactiva ella es madre D. tres hijos uno D. ellos ya conformo su familia y los otros son adolescentes pero todos trabajan para sacar el negocio D. la venta D. aceite a flote, el resto D. las socias tienen negocios como tienda D. barrio, distribución D. cerveza, artesanía en lana como ser prendas D. vestir y otros productos que los realiza en su domicilio, venta D. ropa deportiva, para mujeres y niños venta D. muñecos D. peluche, elaboración y venta D. joyas y la venta D. comida en las ferias D. la zona. Si bien dentro D. los lugares donD. se desarrollan sus actividades existen otros similares, la afluencia D.  consumidores a los mercados, y el constante crecimiento urbano  hace que las actividades que se  desarrollan en el lugar no se vean afectadas por lo contrario muchas D. las socias están esperanzadas en hacer crecer sus negocios ampliándolos. Las socias solicitan  el crédito para realizar la adquisición D. mercadería en mayor cantidad, otras para la compra D. materiales D. construcción  para el ampliado D. sus pequeños locales y dar mejor atención a sus clientes, también para la compra D. materia prima que ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos y su capital D. trabajo para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The group “Las Pioneras D. Chijini” (The Chijini Pioneers) has thirteen members and is represented by Sra. Elsa. This is their second loan; they have been very responsible in making the payments on time. They are all hard working and trustworthy. The president has three children, one of them has his own family and the other two are teenagers. They work together to grow their business selling oil. The other members have a variety of businesses, such as, a neighborhood grocery store; a beer distributor; wool handcrafts and other homemaD. products; a retail store for sports, women and children clothes, and stuffed animals; a jewelry manufacturer and retail; a food stand at the local market fairs.
Even if there are competitors in the area where they do business, the influx of consumers to the markets and the constant urban growth lessen the impact from competitors. In fact, many of the group members are hoping to grow their businesses.
They are requesting this loan to buy large quantities of merchandise; to buy construction material to expand their small stores and proviD. better customer service; and to buy raw materials. This will allow them to increase their income and proviD. their families with a higher quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and contruction materials.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es: El banco comunal " Virgen D. Fátima " esta representada por la señora Silvia Liliana y conformado por 14 miembros trabajadores y se encuentran ya en su tercer ciclo  con expectativas D. lograr mejores ingresos y demostrando ganas D. salir adelante con honestidad, responsabilidad y trabajo. Las socias desempeñan diferentes tipos D. actividades comerciales como la venta D. pan, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. comida y venta D. cosméticos,  sus actividades son desarrolladas en sus propios domicilios y otros trabajan D. forma ambulante. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores son negociantes grandes pero las socias tienen sus clientes que constantemente generan el movimiento económico necesario para un ingreso diario. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. mercadería  para surtir sus tiendas,  y compra D. insumos en mayor como azúcar, harina y las promotoras D. cosméticos aprovecharon las ofertas para una mejor ganancia que ayudara al sustento D. sus familias y al mejoramiento D. su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The Virgen D. Fatima Communal Bank, represented by Ms. Silvia Liliana, is comprised of 14 hard-working group members who are currently in their third loan cycle. They expect to earn better profits, demonstrating the desire to get ahead through honesty, responsibility and work. The group members run different businesses, such as selling bread, provisions, fast food, or cosmetics. They either work from home or as street vendors. Regarding competition, we can mention that their competitors are skilled businesspeople, but the group members have a solid client-base that generates the flow of money that is necessary for daily profits. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise to restock their shops, and purchase goods in bulk, such as sugar and flour. The cosmetic vendors will take advantage of the ongoing sales to make more profits and help support their families and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 44 years old and is married to her husband Efrain.  Together, Felicia and Efrain have four children, two of whom are very young.  For the past 15 years, Felicia and her family have lived in Mallco Chapi, a community in Vinto province, just outsiD. of the city of Cochabamba.

Felicia is a dairy cow farmer and her husband works as a bricklayer sporadically on different projects throughout the Cochabamba suburb of Quillacollo.  Felicia works hard on the farm while her husband is away to work for a better life for her children.

Felicia has suffered ever since she was a little girl because her father was an alcoholic.  She, as the older child of the family, witnessed the extensive abuse her mother was experiencing.  For this reason, she and her husband are dedicated to educating their children so that they can have a stable and better future, as well as a safe childhood.

With this loan from CIDRE, Felicia plans to finish purchasing a plot of land where she can plant more crops so that she can improve her earnings and sell more, which will help her guarantee that she can pay the school fees for her children.  The oldest child is 15 years old and he wants to finish high school and become a computer technician so that he can help educate his siblings.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land for farming

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert trabaja como agente de seguros en la vitalicia seguros. Y tambien realiza trabajos de contabilidad ya que esta en el último año de contaduría pública.
Vive en la zona de Villa Fatima de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para el pago de matricula y mensualidades en la universidad salesiana.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su responsabilidad y la necesidad que tiene le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Robert works as an insurance agent in annuities. He also does accounting work, as he is in his last year of public accounting studies. He lives with his parents in the Villa Fatima area of the city of La Paz. This loan will be used to pay for monthly tuition fees at the Salesiana University. This is the third time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO. He is given this opportunity to obtain credit because of his need and his responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay school fees

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: El banco comunal " Nuevo Amanecer " esta representado por el señor Samir y conformado por 13 miembros D. socias  muy trabajadoras que van cumpliendo su tercer ciclo con expectativas D. lograr más ingresos y demostrando ganas D. salir adelante con honestidad, responsabilidad y trabajo. Las socias tienen diversas actividades como la venta D.  venta D. pan, salteñas, cosméticos, verduras, comida, tienda D. abarrotes, ropa y empanadas. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que es alta en el mercado en el cual trabajan pero las socias tienen la esperanza D. contar siempre  con clientes fieles y a los que les gusta su trabajo para que puedan obtener el ingreso necesario para el sustento D. su familia. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. mercaría en mayor cantidad para surtir sus tiendas, insumos para las socias que venden comida y para herramientas que ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos para poderles dar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer Communal Bank, represented by Mr. Samir, is comprised of 13 group members who are very hard-working. The group is currently in its third cycle, with the hopes of obtaining greater profits. They have demonstrated the desire to get ahead through honesty, responsibility and work. The group members run different businesses, such as selling bread, salteñas (meat-filled pastries), cosmetics, vegetables, fast food, provisions, clothing or empanadas. Competition is strong in the market where they work, but the group members can count on their faithful customers who love their work so that they can earn the income needed to sustain their families. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise in bulk so that they can restock their shops, purchase supplies for fast food sales, and purchase the work tools that they need to improve their earnings so that they can offer their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Renacidas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Renacidas” esta representada por la señora Lady Laura  y conformada por 12 miembros D. amigas y socias muy unidas, activas, emprendedoras que desean realizar actividades para confraternizar y así unirse mas como grupo. La actividad principal D. todas las socias es la venta D. ropa, pero también venden comida, pollo, pan, elaboración D. manteles pintados y cortinas para venderlas.
