En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio, las socias tienen sus clientes fieles que constantemente  generan el movimiento económico necesario para la subsistencia D. sus familias, en caso D. que no les vaya bien el barrio se dirigen a otro lugar o diversifican su actividad económica D. forma que puedan cumplir con las necesidades D. sus hijos. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. mercadería en desaguadero y la adquisición D. insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mejor producto y una mejor ganancia para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida.  En cuanto a la experiencia  en la competencia crediticia los socios cuentan con ella gracias a financiamientos en instituciones similares pero es la primera vez que trabajan con una institución que les brinda confianza y apoyo económico, es por esta razón que desean seguir creciendo junto a nosotros.
texts.en:
The group “Renacidas” is represented by the Señora Laura Leidy, and is maD. up of 12 friends. Its members are very united and active entrepreneurs who desire to carry out activities to promote their friendship and in this way unite themselves more as a group. The principle activity of the members is the sale of clothing, but they also sell food, including chicken and bread, and they make painted tablecloths and curtains to sell. As to the competitive environment, we mention that although there are competitors present in the neighborhood, the members have customers that are very loyal to them who constantly generate the economic activity necessary for the subsistence of their families. In the case that things do not go well in the neighborhood, they can move to another place or diversify their activity so that they can attain the necessities for their children. This loan will be used to buy merchandise in Desaguadero, and to obtain the supplies and tools that will help them to generate better products and better earnings so that they can proviD. their families with a better quality of life. As for credit experience, the members have that thanks to financing from similar institutions, but this is the first time that they are working with an institution that is providing them with confidence and economic support. For this reason they wish to continue growing with us.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operating capital

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
Carmela H. mujer de 59 años, desde que contrajo matrimonio aprendió a elaborar braseros (recipientes pequeños, medianos y grandes que se utiliza para bendecir costumbres). Ella trabaja con Pro Mujer hace 5 años aproximadamente, indica que los préstamos obtenidos le han sido de  utilidad y ahora necesita  seguir comprando materia prima como son los turriles con los cuales elabora los braseros. Carmela cuando tiene una cantidad suficiente vende sus productos a las chifleras (personas que venden yerbas, dulces para bendecir costumbres) de la ciudad de La Paz y Cochabamba. 
Carmela es casada y madre de 5 hijos, 3 de ellos están casados y 2 solteros que también ayudan en la producción de braseros.

Sus compañeras tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de ropa, comida, verduras y tejido de chompas. Todas necesitan  el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios comprando materia prima y mercadería.
texts.en:
Carmela H., age 59, learned how to make braseros (small, medium, and large containers used in traditional blessing ceremonies) when she got married. She has been working with Pro Mujer for approximately 5 years. She states that the loans she has obtained have been very useful to her. She now needs a loan so that she can keep purchasing materials like the barrels she needs to make the braseros. When she has the right quantity, Carmela sells her products to chifleras (people who sell herbs and sweets for blessing ceremonies) in the city of La Paz and Cochabamba.

Carmela is a married mother of five children, 3 of whom are married while 2 are single and help her to produce braseros.

Her fellow group members own different businesses, such as clothing sales, fast food sales, vegetable sales, and sweater weaving. They all need this loan to invest in purchasing raw materials and merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene de ocupación chofer asalariado de la línea de Trufis 88, es soltero y vive en anticrítico con su señora Madre ubicado en la Zona de Tacagua.
 
El crédito lo destinara en incrementar su Anticretico así seguir viviendo en la misma Zona.

Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada  califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Rene.
texts.en:
Rene is a salaried taxi driver for Trufi Route 88. He is single and lives in a rental property with his elderly mother in the district of Tacagua.

His loan will be used to extend his rental contract so that he can continue living in the same area. This is Rene’s first loan with IMPRO. His evaluation indicated that he is qualified for approval of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Extend the contract of his housing rental

loans.name: Simon Lindon

texts.es:
Simon es Chofer propietario de un Trufi de la línea 88, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus tíos ubicado en la Zona Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de un Motor para la movilidad con el que trabaja así tener asegurado sus ingresos.

Es el tercer crédito en IMPRO, sus créditos anteriores fueron pagados puntualmente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Simon.
texts.en:
Simon is an independent taxi driver for Trufi Route 88. He is single and lives in the home of his aunt and uncle, located in the Obispo Bosque district of the city of La Paz.

His loan will be used to buy a motor for his vehicle that is in working condition. This will enable him to have a stable income.

Simon is requesting his third loan from IMPRO. His previous loans were paid on time, and his evaluation indicated that he is approved for this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motor for his taxi

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermín vive en la calle 14 de Junio  de la zona  Pazanqueri de la ciudad de La Paz

Vive en alquiler tiene una hija, a la cual su esposa se dedica al cuidado. 

El trabaja como chofer, todavía debe un 40% de la movilidad con la que trabaja, el esta afiliado al sindicato Eduardo Abaroa, trufi 88.

El crédito lo destinara para la reparación del motor y otros accesorios de su vehiculo,  ya que por el constante uso presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo completas. 
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Fermin resides on June 14th Street in the Pazanqueri district of the city of La Paz. He lives in a rental property and his wife is in charge of looking after their daughter.

Fermin works as a taxi driver along Trufi Route 88 and is affiliated with the Eduardo Abaroa Union. His vehicle is out of commission 40% of the time.

He is requesting a loan to repair his engine and purchase accessories for his vehicle. At the moment, constant mechanical failures are preventing him from completing a full work day.

This is Fermin’s first loan with IMPRO. His evaluation indicates that he is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for engine repairs & vehicle accessories

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, de ocupación  mecánico tiene tres empleados con quienes trabaja en su taller  ubicado en su domicilio propio en la zona Luis Espinal Camps El Alto, su estado civil casado su esposa se ocupa de los quehaceres de la casa y cuidando al hijo de 6 meses de edad. 

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de Maquinaria para el taller de mecánica automotriz, de esa forma podrá incrementar su trabajo para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
 
Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Daniel.
texts.en:
Daniel is a mechanic who has three employees who work with him in his workshop, located in his own home in the Luis Espinal Camps El Alto zone. He is married and his wife takes care of the domestic chores at home and cares for their 6 month old son. The loan will be used to buy machinery for his auto-repair workshop, which will help him to increase his workload and satisfy the needs of his clients. This is Daniel's second loan with IMPRO, who evaluated him and approved his application for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of machinery

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es:
Hilarión  vive en la calle  No 20 de la zona  Huayna Potosí de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en alquiler, tiene cinco hijos los cuales cuida su esposa. 

 Se dedica a la reparación de autos chocados, tiene su propio taller su esposa es la que le colabora en el trabajo. 

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de materiales, como ser lijas, pinturas, masillas por cantidad, así le sale más económico.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Hilarión lives on #20 Street in the Huayna Potosi district of the city of El Alto. He lives in a rental property. His wife looks after their five children.

Hilarión operates an auto collision repair shop. He and his wife manage the business together. His loan will be used to buy materials in bulk such as sandpaper, paints, and putty because it turns out to be more economical. This is Hilarión’s first loan with IMPRO. His evaluation indicates he is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials used for auto body repairs

loans.name: Epifania Margarita

texts.es:
Epifania vive en la Av. Castell zona 16 de Febrero de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en alquiler junto a su mama, tiene un hijo de cinco años, por razones familiares es que su esposo la abandono ella sola mantienes a su hijo y la vez sale adelante en la vida.

La señora trabaja en un empresa de muebles hace cuatro años, además vende perfumes, y otros productos en la misma empresa.


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de perfumes y otros productos. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con IMPRO  la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Epifania lives on Castell Avenue in the February 16th district of the city of El Alto. She lives in a rental property with her mother and her 5 year old son. Her husband abandoned the family, so she must raise her son alone and provide for his success in life.

Epifania worked at a furniture company four years ago, but she now sells perfumes and other products. Her loan will be used to purchase more items to add to her inventory.

This is Epifania’s second loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicates she is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfumes & other products

loans.name: Luis Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa con los acopiadores mayoristas como ser Pil Andina y Delicia (Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche), es soltero y vive en la casa de sus Padres en la comunidad Irpa Chico Prov. Ingavi a hora y media de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar la producción de leche para poder tener mejores ingresos.

Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Rodolfo.
texts.en:
Rodolfo raises dairy cattle in order to produce milk to sell to wholesalers such as Pil Andina and Delicia (industrial milk plants). He is single and lives with his parents in the community of Irpa Chico, Ingavi Province, which 1½ hours away from the city of El Alto.

Rodolfo will use his loan to buy another dairy cow so that he can increase his milk production and generate better earnings. This is his first loan with IMPRO. His evaluation indicates he is qualified for approval of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Máxima Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el mercado Israel Lewites del departamento de Managua, la señora Maxima del Socorro R. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el que es atendido por ella misma para satisfacer a sus clientes que le visitan. Entre los productos que ella vende se encuentran granos básicos, comestibles, bebidas, productos personales, entre otros.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de todos estos productos ya que la pulpería requiere aumentar su inventario porque son muchos los clientes que le visitan y todos requieren ser atendidos y así comprar lo que se les ofrece.
texts.en:
At the Israel Lewites Market in the department of Managua, Sra. Maxima del Socorro R. manages her retail business so that she can satisfy the needs of the customers who visit her. Among the products she sells are basic grains, snacks, beverages, toiletries, and other items.

She has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan so that she can buy more of these products to increase her inventory. Sra. Maxima has many customers who come by with their requests, so she wants to attend to their needs and offer them as much as she can.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Franz

texts.es:
Franz tiene 33 años, vive con sus padres, su pareja y madre de su hija, en su casa propia. Él tiene un motocarro, del cual es propietario y trabaja con él durante todo el día transportando personas por los diferentes lugares de su ciudad. Esta actividad la viene ejerciendo desde hace 10 años atrás. Por otro lado, también aprovecha las oportunidades de trabajo en compañías petroleras que lo contratan como obrero, y en la mayoría de veces tiene que viajar a otros lugares lejos de su hogar.
Lo que más le gusta a Franz de su actividad como transportista es brindar seguridad a sus clientes y que los mismos se sientan tranquilos cuando él los lleva. Además, este negocio le es rentable porque ya tiene clientes regulares quienes lo contratan para que los transporte a sus centros de trabajo. 
Posteriormente, Franz quiere comprar otro motocarro y así brindar oportunidad de trabajo (como  chofer) a quien lo necesite. 

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su grupo es que ha notado que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y confiables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Franz is 33 years old and lives in his own home with his partner, who is the mother of their daughter. His parents also live with them. He owns a motorcycle taxi and works during the day transporting people to different places within the city. Franz has been in this business for the past 10 years. In addition, he also takes advantage of opportunities from petroleum companies who hire him as a laborer. Franz usually has to travel far from home for these jobs.

What Franz enjoys about being a motorcycle taxi driver is providing a safe environment for his customers since they feel relaxed around him. He feels his business is profitable because he has a regular clientele who hire him in order to travel to work each day. In the future, Franz would like to buy another motorcycle taxi so that he can provide employment to another driver in need of work.

This is his first loan with MFP. Franz enjoys working with his Communal Bank because all the members are responsible and reliable. He will use the money he requested to buy spare parts so that he can repair his motorcycle taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Domingo José

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor Domingo José Madríz se ha preocupado por mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su esposa y su hijo en edad escolar. Se ha planteado mejorar las condiciones de vida por medio del mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que ha sido muy lastimada a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo.

Para ello, el señor Domingo espera en que su crédito le sea otorgado y con este comprará los materiales de construcción para continuar la obra y así brindarle a sus hijos un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Domingo José M. has been worrying about improving the living conditions of his family, made up of his wife and his school-aged son. He has considering improving their living conditions by working on their house which has deteriorated with the passing of time. For this reason Domingo hopes that his loan will be granted so that he can purchase construction materials. With these materials he will continue working on his house so as to provide his children with a dignified place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Felix Alejandro

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor Feliz C. como todo padre responsable y comprometido con el bienestar de sus hijos, se dedica a trabajar fuertemente para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Actualmente ha solicitado un crédito para contribuir al desarrollo de sus hijos por medio de la compra de una computadora para que ellos puedan estudiar y realizar los trabajos de su colegio. Espera muy confiadamente en que el crédito le servirá de mucho y de esta manera mejorará las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
In the town of Managua, Mr. Felix C., as any father, responsible and commited to the well-being of his children, works hard to provide for his family.

Presently Mr. C. has requested a loan to contribute to the development of his children by buying them a computer so they can study and make their homework. He is confident that the loan will serve him well, and this way improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer for his children to study.

loans.name: Mayaqui Sartasiñani Group

texts.es: Mayaqui Sartasiñani es un grupo numeroso de 16 integrantes, todas alegres y carismáticas, este grupo se reúne cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal German Busch. Su presidenta es Beatriz E. indica que están juntas hace 4 años aproximadamente y en esta oportunidad también necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y materia prima, según el negocio que tengan ya que todas tienen diversas actividades, pero  la mayoría teje mantas para mujeres, especialmente para que se luzcan en diferentes fiestas, otra buena parte vende ropa de mujer, hombre y niño, las demás integrantes tienen negocios como venta de papa frita, cereales y fruta.
texts.en:
Mayaqui Sartasiñani is a group of 16 entrepreneurs, all of them happy and charismatic. They meet every two weeks in the German Busch regional office of Pro Mujer. Their president, Beatriz E., states that they have been together about 4 years and at this time need a loan to buy merchandise and raw materials for the various diverse businesses in the group.

The majority of group members sew traditional women’s shawls, especially those that are worn in holiday celebrations. Another large part of the group is in sales of women’s, men’s, and children’s clothing. The others have businesses such as the sale of fried potatoes, grains, or fruit.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Micaela Mercedes

texts.es:
La venta de comida es la actividad a la que se ha dedicado la señora Micaela H. desde hace cuatro años y habiéndose ubicado en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua.

Es importante destacar que la señora Micaela no posee un buen local para desarrollar la venta por lo que anhela tener su propio establecimiento donde vender. El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de la mercadería para preparar la comida como lo es la fritanga y de esta manera ofrecerla a los clientes.
texts.en:
For the past four years Mrs. Micaela H. has been selling food for a living. She is located at the market Israel Lewites in the town of Managua.

It is important to mention that Mrs. Micaela does not have good premises to carry out sales and therefore it is her greatest wish to own premises for her sales. The loan will be spent on buying ingredients to cook the food, such as fried snacks, for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for food production.

loans.name: Nelly Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el M. Israel Lewites de Managua, la señora Nelly M. se ha destacado por vender colchones elaborados por ella misma y los que son ofrecidos en su establecimiento y aunque las ventas han estado muy bajas ella busca la forma de cómo superar esto y continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.

Muy sabiamente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito para la compra de la materia prima como lo es la tela, hilaza, ziper, esponja, entre otros. Es de importancia destacar que ella también sale a vender fuera de Managua (en otros departamentos) y todo con el fin de ganarse la vida y llevar el pan a su mesa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nelly M. has excelled at selling mattresses, made by herself, at the market Israel Lewites in Managua. They are being sold at her premises and even if sales have been poor, she is finding ways to exceed and continue to provide for her family.

Wisely she has approached Ceprodel to request a loan to buy raw materials such as cloth, yarn, zippers, sponges, among others. It is important to mention that she also sells outside Managua (in other departments) in order to earn a living and provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ppurchase raw materials to make mattresses.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto tiene 56 años, es padre de tres hijos que son estudiantes y vive junto a su esposa quien lo apoya mucho, sobre todo en su negocio.

Desde hace 5 años cuenta con una chacra (terreno de cultivo), la cual se encuentra a dos horas de viaje en bote por el río Ucayali. Se dedica a la producción de frutas cítricas (naranjas, limón, toronja y mandarinas), las mismas que hacen un total de 8 hectáreas cultivadas. 
Lo que le gusta a Humberto de su trabajo es mantener en buen estado sus plantas para que sigan produciendo como es debido, además le es rentable porque cosecha cada semana entre 1000 a 1500 frutas listos para el mercado. Para ello, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien es muy buena comerciante, pero también tiene clientes que acuden a su chacra para comprar sus frutas directamente.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que gracias a esta metodología está saliendo adelante en su negocio. Además que sus compañeros son personas responsables y solidarias. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abono para sus plantas, así como granos de arroz para sembrar en su chacra, ya que se acerca la temporada de este cereal.
texts.en:
Humberto is 56 years old, a father of three school-going children and lives with his wife who supports him much, especially with his business.

For 5 years he has had a small farm, a two-hour boat ride away on the river Ucayali. He grows citrus fruits (oranges, lemons, grapefruits, and tangerines) on 8 hectares. Don Humberto enjoys keeping his plants in good state to continue producing properly. On the other hand it is profitable because he harvests between 1000 and 1500 pieces of fruit ready for the market each week. He counts on the support of his wife who is a very good saleswoman, but he also has customers that come to his farm to buy his fruits directly.

This is second loan with MFP and he likes to work with his community bank as due to this methodology he is getting ahead with his business, and his partners are responsible and solidary individuals. With the money requested he will buy fertilizers for his plants as well as rice grains to be sown on his farm as the season for this cereal is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and rice seeds.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
Lina tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo quien se dedica al transporte de carga, y con su hija que es mayor de edad y ya trabaja. 

Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la costura, es muy buena elaborando ropa para damas, niños y la lencería, lo hace en su taller que implementó en su propia casa, y posteriormente la vende de manera ambulante. Por otro lado, Lina también se dedica a la elaboración de aretes, collares, zapatos y carteras, artículos que decora con mostacillas y piedras de diversos colores. Y por su fuera poco, también está en el negocio de la venta de madera (tablas, listones y cantoneras).
Lo que le gusta de sus actividades es mantenerse ocupada, sobre todo observar como cada día va creciendo económicamente, ya que obtiene buenas ganancias de todas las actividades que realiza
Para más adelante, quiere mandar a construir un local adecuado donde pueda distribuir un ambiente para cada uno de sus negocios.   

Este es su 3er crédito con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros/as son personas animosas, comunicativas, amigables y sobre todo, se apoyan entre sí. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará telas, hilos y otros materiales textiles para seguir activa en la costura; también invertirá en su negocio de venta de madera y la bijouteria.
texts.en:
Lina is 50 years old, she lives with her husband who transports cargo and her daughter who is of legal age and works.

For 10 years she has been a dressmaker, she is very good making garments for ladies, children and lingerie at her workshop which is installed in her own house. She sells from door to door. On the other hand, Lina also makes earrings, necklaces, shoes, and wallets which she decorates with beeds and colored stones. And if this was not enough, she also sells wood (planks, strips, and cants). She likes to keep busy especially when she sees daily economical growth as she gets good earnings from all her activities. For the future she would like to build adequate premises with a section for each of her businesses.

This is her 3rd loan with MFP and what she likes about her community bank is that her partners are enthusiastic, communicative, and friendly individuals, and above all, they support each other. With the money requested she will buy cloth, yarn and other textile materials to keep active with the dressmaking. She will also invest in her business selling wood and imitation jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase textile materials

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 52 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo de 21 años, quien es soltero y trabaja.
Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la compra de madera, la cual lleva a un aserradero donde las convierten en tablillas; posteriormente María las vende a cualquier proyecto de construcción o en un local que acondicionó al costado de su casa
Con esta actividad Maria ha solventado las necesidades y educación de su hijo, quien es su inspiración de seguir luchando. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es relacionarse con muchas personas y mantenerse activa, además le es rentable porque la madera en de gran demanda en la zona de selva donde ella vive.
 
Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, se siente a gusto trabajar con su banco comunal porque se distrae durante las reuniones de grupo y porque todos son responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más madera para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is a 52 year-old single mother. She lives with her son who is 21 years old, single and employed. For 12 years she has been buying wood, which are then sawed into timber (small boards). María sells the timber to construction projects or directly from her house. This business has allowed Maria to support her family expenses and her son’s education. Her son gives her inspiration to continue to work hard.
She enjoys her work because she interacts with a lot of people and keeps her active. It is also a profitable business because timber is in great demand where she lives.
This is her second loan with Microfinanza Prisma. She likes to work with her communal bank because she enjoys the group meetings and everyone is very responsible with their payments. She will use this loan to buy more wood to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more wood.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros tiene 26 años, es soltera, vive en casa de una tía, con ella y sus primos. Desde hace 2 años cuenta con pequeño puesto en el mercado donde vende ropa variada. Allí atiende durante todo el día y de lunes a domingo.
Lo que más le gusta a Milagros de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes, ella trata de perfeccionar su habilidad como negociante cada vez más, pues sabe que vender roda es un negocio muy rentable, además que su puesto en el mercado tiene una buena ubicación.
Su deseo a futuro es tener una tienda de ropa donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad y sea más cómodo para sus clientes.

Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su grupo es que todos los integrantes son personas muy responsables y puntuales en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa y de esa manera seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Milagros is 26, single, and lives at the home of an aunt and her cousins. For the last two years she has had a small stall in a market where she sells a variety of clothing. She works there all day Mondays through Sundays. What Milagros likes most about her work is to give good service to her customers. She tries to greatly improve her skill as a salesperson every day since she knows that to sell clothing is a good business. Besides her stall has a good location in the market. Her dream for the future is to have a clothing store where she can sell clothes to her customers in a calmer and more comfortable setting. This is her 4th loan with MFP and what she likes about the group is that all the participants are very responsible and punctual about their payments. The money that she is requesting will be used to buy more clothing and thus increase her business. .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 29 años, ella es una mujer muy proactiva para los negocios. Es madre de 3 hijos que son estudiantes, vive con su pareja, que es el padre de sus hijos, quien la apoya en su negocio. 

En una parte de su terreno tiene un pequeño aserradero donde toda la madera que compra la convierten tablillas listas para la venta. En esta labor ya tiene un periodo de 6 años y le está yendo muy bien, generalmente lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la administración del mismo, y estar pendiente de sus trabajadores. Nelly considera que su actividad le es rentable porque es un negocio propio, cuenta con clientes regulares y sus ventas son diarias, por lo que obtiene ganancias satisfactorias.
Para más adelanta quiere constituir un local para que su negocio tenga el espacio adecuado para su mejor funcionamiento.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que ha notado que sus compañeros son personas responsables, y sobre todo, muy organizadas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más madera para seguir activa en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelly is 29 years old; she is a very proactive woman with businesses. She is the mother of 3 children who are students. She lives with her partner who is the father of her children and who supports her in her business.

On part of her land, she has a small sawmill where she converts the wood she buys into ready to sell clapboards. She has had this business for a period of 6 years now and it’s going very well. In general, what she likes most about this job is managing the business and keeping an eye on her workers. Nelly considers her work to be worthwhile because it is her own business; she has regular customers and daily sales, so she has been able to obtain satisfactory earnings. In order to move forward, she wants to build a place for her business that has adequate space for making the business run better.

This is the first time that she has had a loan with MFP and what she likes about the communal bank is that she noticed that her partners are very responsible, and above all, very organized. With funds she is requesting, she will buy more wood to keep her business active.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Solei

texts.es:
Solei tiene 34 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hija de 13 años y dos sobrinos en la casa de su madre.

Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso y de zapatos, en un puesto del mercado de su localidad. Gracias a esta labor está logrando solventar los estudios de su hija, a quien espera ver, más adelante, como una buena profesional. 
Lo que le gusta a Solei de su trabajo es relacionarse con varias personas y aprender sobre el comercio y las técnicas de venta. Por otro lado, cree que su negocio le es rentable porque el precio de las prendas es muy accesible. 
Para el futuro desea tener una tienda donde puede vender su mercadería con mayor comodidad.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, está muy entusiasmada con conocer más sobre la forma de trabajo en un banco comunal y ya ha notado que sus compañeros de grupo son personas confiables y muy responsables. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa de segundo uso para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Solei is 34 years old and a single mother. She lives with her 13 year old daughter and two nephews in her mother's house.

For the past 3 years she has dedicated herself to selling used clothes and shoes in a stand in her local market. Thanks to this work she is able to pay for her daughter's studies, who she hopes will one day become a good professional. For her work Solei wants to make contacts with various people and learn about business and selling techniques. She believes that her business is profitable because the price of her clothing is very affordable. For the future she hopes to have a store where she can sell her merchandise with greater convenience.

This is Solei's first loan with MFP. She is very enthusiastic to know more about working with a communal bank and already has noticed that her group members are reliable and responsible people. Solei will use the money she is asking for to buy more used clothes to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Victor Albino

texts.es:
El señor Victor albino I., está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual lo utilizo para poner la luz y el drenaje ya que era lo mas importante para habitar la vivienda.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder terminar los acabados de la casa y así este en mejor estado para sus hijos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de su  ingreso que obtiene de su trabaja como guardia de seguridad privada.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor Albino I. is very grateful for the help with his last loan. He used it to install electricity and plumbing to make his home more liveable. He is again asking for a loan so that he can complete the house and have it in better shape for his children. He plans to pay the loan with a part of the money that he gets from his work as a private security guard.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish up the inside and outside of his home

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Gloria T. le está haciendo falta las protecciones en las ventanas y puerta.
Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar las protecciones. Es por es por eso que solicita el préstamo y así su casa y familia estarán mas seguras cuando ella y su esposo se encuentre en su trabajo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con su ingreso de su trabajo como policía en la ciudad, ya que su esposo se encargara de los gastos familiares con su ingreso que obtiene como también de policía en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
La persona que aparece en la foto es el señor Humberto Hernández esposo de la señora Gloria T., ya que cuando fuimos a la visita  la Doña Gloria estaba en horas del trabajo.
texts.en:
The home of Mrs. Gloria T. is missing the security bars for the windows and the door. But at this time she doesn’t have the money to pay the person who makes them. That is why she is asking for a loan and then her home will be safer when she and her husband are at work. She plans to pay the loan with her husband’s salary since her husband pays the household expenses from his salary as a policeman in Nuevo Laredo. The person shown in the photo is Mr. Humberto Hernandez, Gloria T.’ husband because Gloria was at work when we went to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and install security bars on the windows and doors

loans.name: Llany

texts.es: La señora Llany, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”,  Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Divorciada, tiene 46 años y 03 hijos,  que estudian y aun depende de ella. Anteriormente, Llany se dedicaba a brindar pensión y al servicio de Motokar y su amor y cariño a sus hijos, le  motivaron a buscar alternativas de generar fuentes de ingresos y gracias a su cualidad de ser una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, le ayudaron a iniciarse en la venta de chupetes, nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien y poco a poco ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo por que ven que el producto que ella ofrece tiene muy buena acogida y sobretodo son atendidos con amabilidad que es lo que a ella le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de su producto como azúcar en kilos,  cajas de leche y frutas que a diario necesita para la preparación de los chupetes, a diario cuenta con sus productos surtidos, para así poder captar una mayor clientela. Llany, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Llany is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Trabajadoras” (The Workers), which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 46 years old, divorced, and has 3 dependent children attending school.

Llany previously operated a boarding house and provided motorcycle transport services. Her love of children motivated her to seek alternative sources of income. Thanks to her hard work and entrepreneurial spirit, she decided to sell lollipops. She says business is doing very well and that she is steadily gaining more customers. Llany continues to manage her business to this day. Her products are well received and she treats all of her customers with kindness.

With this loan of 1000 soles, Llany will buy ingredients used in making her product such as sugar by the kilo, cartons of milk, and fruit. She prepares a wide assortment of lollipops each day so that she can attract a larger clientele. Llany feels strong enough to continue working and persevering day after day. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping women like her and providing them with opportunities to develop in the communities where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making lollipops

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: La señora Santos, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años y es madre de una niña de 10 años y es por esta razón, que ella se esfuerza.Santos, se dedica a la venta de mercería, lleva 10 años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, en un puesto muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, nos cuenta que le va muy bien. Santos, es una mujer muy trabajadora que día a día, se esfuerza mas para así cumplir sus demás sueños y darle a su pequeña hija, una buena educación y verla profesional, mas adelante.En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará mercería muy variada como juguetes de plástico para niños, elástico en rollos, blondas con diferentes diseños, hilos y botones en diferentes colores y tamaños, cosméticos como colonias, cremas, lápiz labiales, esmaltes de diferentes marcas, todo esto hará que su clientela aumente y este contenta y por lo tanto sus ganancias serán mayores.Santos, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Santos is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Trabajadoras” (The Workers), which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of a 10 year old daughter. Santos works in order to support her daughter.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a haberdashery in the central market of the district. Her store is well-equipped to accommodate her customers. She indicates that her business is doing well. Santos works hard every day so that she can fulfill her dreams and provide her young daughter with a good education so that she can become a successful professional. At the moment, she has loyal customers who come by her store every day to shop. She welcomes everyone individually with her charming personality.

With this loan of 3000 soles, Santos will buy a variety of merchandise for her haberdashery such as plastic toys for children, rolls of elastic, lace in different designs, threads, and buttons in different colors and sizes. She will also purchase cosmetics such as colognes, crèmes, lipsticks, and nail polishes of different brands. The additional inventory will enable her to attract more customers and keep them happy. As a results, her earnings should be higher.

Santos now feels that she is an accomplished woman who is eager to move forward and realize her dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting many more women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her haberdashery

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 37 años y es madre de 3 hijos, quienes todavía dependen de ella y están estudiando.Juanita, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la venta de mercería y mercadería de ropas, lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, donde cordialmente atiende a sus clientes. Juana, es una mujer muy trabajadora que día a día, se esfuerza mas para así cumplir sus demás sueños y darle a sus hijos, una buena educación.En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar y es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes, con el carisma que siempre le ha caracterizado. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará mercería muy variada como juguetes de plástico para niños y niñas, cosméticos como colonias, cremas, lápiz labiales, esmaltes de diferentes marcas, todo esto hará que su clientela aumente y este contenta y por lo tanto sus ganancias serán mayores. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería de ropas y utensilios de cocina.Juanita, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the communal bank "Las Trabajadoras," which is located in the Juanjui district of Mariscal Cáceres province, in the San Martín region. She is 37 years old, married, and is the mother of 3 dependent children who are in school. Juanita, as she is called with affection, is engaged in the business of selling clothing and other items. She has been in this line of work for a number of years. She conducts her business from her house, which is well-equipped and is a place where she can cordially attend to her customers. Juana is a hardworking woman who, day by day, exerts herself more so that she can accomplish her dreams and give her children a good education. She currently has a loyal clientele who come to her place daily to buy, and she personally attends to them with her characteristic charisma. With this loan of S/. 1,700.00, she will buy all kinds of items such as plastic toys for children, and cosmetics such as colognes, creams, lipstick, and different brands of nail polish. All of this will make her clientele grow and be satisfied, and accordingly her earnings will improve. Part of the money will also be used to buy merchandise such as clothing and kitchen utensils. Today Juanita feels like a very accomplished woman, who has a strong desire to continue to advance and make her dreams a reality. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for helping her to start her business and for helping many women who want to grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and other merchandise

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: S. is 26 years old and a resident of Kampong Chhnang Province. She currently sews clothes for a garment factory and gets a specific salary of $90 per month. She is married with no children yet. Her husband, Mr. Sokea, age 28, is a motor taxi driver (he appears in the picture). Recently, S.'s husband can't earn much income because his motorbike often breaks down and is not attractive. Therefore, S. decided to request a loan for her husband to replace his old motorcycle.

loans.use: To replace her husband's old motorcycle

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang S., 35, lives in the province of Kompong Chhnang, Cambodia, where she owns a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She can plant her crops twice a year.  She was taught this by her grandfather. She is currently a good mother of two school-aged children. To help meet a little more of the family's needs, her husband climbs the palm trees to tap the palm juice and turns it into palm sugar for a profit. Neang S. will use her first loan to purchase a cow. She will use the cow to help reduce her hard labor on the farm.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La señora Carmen, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín, es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.Carmen, lleva 4 años dedicándose al negocio, se encuentra ubicada  en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, donde cuenta con un ambiente, muy bien acondicionado, para  atender a sus clientes. Las ventas que diariamente realiza, le ha valido para ir mejorando su negocio y aumentando sus productos.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará menestras regionales y de la costa como: fréjoles cocinados, pimientos licuados, colorantes, ajíes  maíz morado, piñas, guayabas brasileras en cajones para elaborar sus esencias y así satisfacer el exigente pedido de su clientela.Carmencita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy orgullosa por el trabajo, que realiza día a día, el buen producto que vende le ha proporcionado clientela fiel que compra todos los días. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional a mujeres como ella, que quieren salir adelante y generar sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Trabajadoras” (The Workers), which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 33 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 dependent children. Carmen has been in business for 4 years and has a vending post in the district central market that is well-suited for accommodating her customers. She generates sales on a daily basis, so she wants to improve her business and expand her offering of products.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will purchase ingredients and essences for making regional stews such as cooked beans, pepper sauce, food coloring, hot peppers, purple corn, pineapples, and Brazilian guavas by the case. These items will enable her to satisfy the demanding tastes of her customers.

Carmencita, as she is known to many, is very proud of her work and of the high-quality food she sells to her loyal customers every day. She thanks Manuela Ramos for providing unconditional support to women like her who want to succeed and generate their own income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making regional stews

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: Nuo S., 54 years old, is a snack food seller. She operates her business in the local market where she rents a small kiosk for selling her produce. Besides selling food, she and her husband always cultivate a rice crop when the farming season approaches. Nuo S. is a good mother blessed with four kids. Two of her daughters are employed in the garment factory in Phnom Penh. Nuo S. said that her current income is not adequate to support her family and in order to earn extra income she hopes to run a suitable business, but she doesn’t have money yet to invest in it. Therefore, she decided to look for capital on Kiva to purchase a set of music instruments, which she will use to provide a music service for wedding party. This loan will provide her with additional income and a good standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a set of music instruments, which she will use to provide a music service for wedding party

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: S., 36, is a village woman living in Kampong Chhnang Province. Since the beginning of 1992, S. and her husband have been operating a grocery business from their home. S. sells her items to her neighbors who live near her house in the village. She now has five school-aged children who live with her in the family home. Due to the coming mature rice season, S. requests a loan for capital to order rice in bulk from farmers to store and then sell when rice is commanding its highest price.

loans.use: To order rice in bulk from farmers

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 20 años y es madre de 01 hija pequeña niña, que aun depende de ella.Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas y a su corta edad, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de comida diaria tipo menú, ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito.Lleva 02 años dedicándose al negocio y hoy en día  cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su puesto de venta de comidas, donde ella los atiende con la amabilidad y carisma que siempre le ha caracterizado.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,700.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceite en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante, Adela, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Jackeline is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Trabajadoras” (The Workers), which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 20 years old, single, and the mother of a young daughter who is financially dependent on her.

Secure in her knowledge of preparing different foods, Jackeline used her first loan of 300 soles to start a business selling prepared meals at the central market in her district. She has been in business for two years and now has a loyal clientele who visit her food stall on a daily basis. She welcomes her customers with her kind and charming personality.

With this loan of 1700 soles, Jackeline will buy supplies for her daily food preparation such as sacks of rice, sugar, packets of oil, cases of chicken, and utensils. These items will keep her business running and enable her to provide better service to her customers. She is prepared for anything and still feels strongly about working in order to succeed. Jackeline thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing food

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: A small-sized wooden house in Kampong Chhnang is the location of Mrs. Nhem M.'s home and grocery store. She usually buys produce in bulk from a market supplier and sells it from her house. Normally, she can make an average income of $6.00 per day. She has been running her business since early 2000. Nhem M. is a single woman who tries to earn money for herself. Nhem M.'s investment is her main source of income and she recently sold all of the produce in her store. Therefore, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: S. is 27 years of age and currently lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, in Cambodia. S. and her husband own a small building business, where they work as construction foremen. They have a few employees. From their investment, they normally make around $10 of revenue per day. This couple has two young children who are dependent on their income. S. said that she and her husband always pay a lot of money for a taxi to go to their work place. S. hopes to cut this cost by using a Kiva loan to purchase a used motorbike, which she will use for traveling purposes.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike

loans.name: Khloem

texts.en: Mrs. Khloem S. is a low-income person who is 33 years of age. She currently depends on selling fish in the local busy market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. Khloem S. is a humble mother who has been blessed with five school-aged children. Now the river is full of fish due to the coming fish season. Khloem S.’s husband can’t catch a lot of fish because he lacks tools to use for the fishing activities. Therefore, Khloem S. has decided to seek a loan, which will enable her husband to purchase extra tools to fish.

loans.use: To purchase extra tools to fish

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Sek M. is a rice cultivator who has been farming for seven years. She is a 52-year-old wife and mother. Her husband, Sophal, age 49, is a construction worker. This couple lives with a school-aged child. Sek M. is currently planting a rice crop which she will harvest when mature. Recently, her crop is not growing well because it is ravaged by insects and weeds. Because of that obstacle, Sek M. has decided to seek a loan to buy insecticide, which she will use to protect her crop.

loans.use: To buy insecticide

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 74 años y es madre D. 07 hijos,  02 que aun depenD. D. ella y está estudiando.Juana, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada en el Mercado Central D. su Distrito y lleva 27 años en el negocio, tiene un puesto muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores D. la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen, cuenta con muy buena acogida.En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, venD. en las mañanas D. 9:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atienD. a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria D. sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos D. papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Se siente con ganas D. seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda D. abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs Juana belongs to the communal bank “Las Trabajadoras” (the Workers), in the Juanjui District, in the Province of Mariscal Caceres, San Martin Department. She is a widow, 74 years old and the mother of 7, 2 who are still her dependents and are students. Juana has been selling prepared food in the Central Market of her District for the last 27 years. She has a well-appointed stall to serve her customers. She tells us that every day she has many customers because of the tasty food that she prepares. Her main customers are residents of the city, passersby, and regulars who already know her. She is very popular. Currently she is still doing the same business and she’s very happy with her daily work. She sells in the mornings from 9 am to 2 pm. She is the one who personally takes care of her customers with her characteristic enthusiasm. With the loan of 1,500 soles, she will buy ingredients for the daily preparation of the food such as kilos of rice, sugar, gallons of oil, bags of potatos, quantities of chickens, vegetables and also utensils to improve her business and to better care for her customers. She is determined to get ahead. She has many dreams and goals in her life, such as to open her own well-stocked grocery store. She would like to thank the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for their help in starting her business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Ourn's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan request for two borrowers. The leader, Mr. Ourn A., age 33, is a basket seller. He sells baskets his wife makes or buys them from other basket weavers. Ourn A. currently lives with his two young children who attend school and help weave bamboo baskets for sale. Ourn A. sells his products very well because he sells at a reasonable price. Recently, part of his inventory has been sold. He hopes to acquire more stock to continue selling, but he doesn't have enough money. Therefore, he would like a loan to order baskets from other weavers to sell.

The other borrower, Mr. Van B., is a bamboo basket seller who is requesting a loan to buy more baskets to sell. Van B.'s wife is in the photo.

loans.use: To order baskets from other weavers to sell

loans.name: Dou's Group

texts.en:
There are four low-income people who have decided to request a loan, which they will use for a various purposes. Mrs. Dou Y., 53 years of age, has been selected to be the leader of the loan. She currently lives with her eight children and her husband, who stays at home to weave bamboo baskets to sell. To earn a living, Dou Y. has owned a small handicraft business as a bamboo basket weaver since 1980. She saves up over one hundred sets of baskets before she sells them. Dou Y. lacks raw materials for her business so she requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more bamboo to make baskets. The other borrowers are:
N., a basket seller, is applying for a loan to use as capital to buy more items to sell. 
S., who sells bamboo baskets that she buys in bulk from her wholesale supplier, asks for a loan to purchase more baskets to meet the needs of her customers.
S. will use her loan to purchase more raw materials to weave bamboo baskets.

loans.use: To purchase more bamboo to make baskets

loans.name: Yoli

texts.es: La señora Yoli, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las trabajadoras”, Distrito Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 02  hijos, los 02 que aun depende de ella.Yoli lleva en su negocio 4 años, es una mujer perseverante, eficiente y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de mercadería de  ropas, en un pequeño ambiente, muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa. Cada quincena del mes, para que su mercadería salga rápido y pueda seguir invirtiendo, se traslada por diferentes pueblos aledaños, a ofrecer sus mercaderías de ropas, ya que cuenta con clientes fijos, que la conocen por esos lugares. Actualmente, nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien en su negocio. Su espíritu luchador y el gran optimismo, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  más mercadería de ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yoli belongs to the community bank “Las trabajadoras”, located in the District Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, San Martín Department. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner and is the mother of 2 children. Her 2 children are still dependent on her. Yoli has had her business for 4 years; she is a persevering, efficient and capable woman. She has a clothing business in a small, well equipped area of her own home. Every two weeks, she travels to different nearby towns to sell her clothing merchandise. This way she can sell her clothing quickly and continue to invest her earnings. She now has regular clients that she meets in these nearby towns. Nowadays, she tells us that her business is doing very well. Her fighting spirit and great optimism helps her to grow as an independent woman and she is proud of what she has achieved. With this loan of S/. 3,000.00, she will buy more clothing merchandise to stock her inventory including pants, shorts, blouses in all sizes and models, polo shirts and dresses for adults and girls. She feels like an established and hardworking woman and she is grateful for the opportunity that the Manuela Ramos Movement has offered her, thus developing herself as woman and small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more clothing merchandise

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en: S. is a 45-year-old farmer and mother. She is blessed with seven kids, four of whom are attending the public high school and are dependent on her income. The others are employed. Her husband, Sin Somoeun, is 46 years of age, and works in construction. In the past, S. and her family always hired a taxi for traveling anywhere because they don't have a vehicle.  Because of that, S. is looking for a loan to add to her personal savings in order to buy a used motorcycle for her and her family's touring needs.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Roeuk

texts.en: Roeuk S., 30, lives in Battambang province, Cambodia where she owns a piece of farmland. She grows rice, which she plants twice a year. Besides her farm work, Roeuk S. and her husband always sell sugar cane juice in front of her home to her neighbors. They are the good parents of four children. Three of them are students and other one is still young. The family also finds it hard traveling anywhere, because they don’t have their own vehicle. Roeuk S. would like a loan from Kiva through HKL in order to purchase a motorbike. The new motorbike saves the family from hiring a taxi. Note: Roeuk S. was not available at the time, so her husband is shown in the picture instead.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Enith

texts.es: La señora Enith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sembrando Futuro”, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 30 años, 03 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Enith, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de menú y por motivos de salud, fue que dejo dedicarse a este negocio, hoy en día nos cuenta que con el fin de incrementar sus propios ingresos económicos y motivada por  ella misma, comenzó a dedicarse a la confección de ropas interiores, donde por las tardes se dirige a ofrecer a sus clientes, donde  poco a poco fue haciéndose mas conocida.Hoy continúa con su negocio ubicada en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos, nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que tiene clientes fijos.Con este préstamo de S/. 600.00, comprará telas de algodón, para incrementar su stock de ropas interiores como: calzones, bikinis, brasieres, pijamas, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Enith, tiene un carácter alegre y un carisma para vender a sus clientes,  comenta que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos como organización ayuda a las mujeres a desarrollarse y progresar con la misma oportunidad que el varón.
texts.en:
Señora Enith belongs to the communal bank "Sembrando Futuro," which is located in the Tarapoto district of San Martin province, in the San Martin region. She is 30 years old, and lives with her partner and her 3 dependent children. Previously, Enith sold prepared food, but because of health reasons she left that business. She tells us that, motivated by the aim of increasing her income, she began to produce undergarments. In the afternoons she offers them to her customers where, little by little, she is becoming known in this line of business. Today she continues with this business, which is located in her house; her main customers are her neighbors and friends. She tells us that it is going very well, since she has regular customers. With this loan of S/. 600.00, she will buy cotton fabrics in order to increase her stock of undergarments such as: panties, bikinis, brassieres, and pajamas for women, men and children. Enith has a cheerful personality and a charisma for selling to her customers. She comments that the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization helps women to develop and advance with the same opportunities as men.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials used in the production of undergarments

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo T. is a 56-year-old married woman and a good homemaker. She currently stays at home to care for the children and do housework. She depends on income from her husband who is a community consultant adviser. Her husband (pictured) also catches fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake for additional profit. This couple has three school-age and four employed children. Keo T. will be using part of her loan to buy more fishing tools for her husband.  She will use the rest of the loan to repair her existing vehicle that breaks down frequently.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tools and repair her vehicle

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Kem M. is a long-time businesswoman. She has been growing rice on her own farmland since she was single. Besides her farm work, she also sells a few fish that she gets from her husband's fishing. Kem M. is a good mother blessed with seven teenage children. Two of the children are employed; one is a garment worker and the other one drives a motor taxi. Kem M. is taking out her loan to repair the broken fishing equipment as well as buy more tools for her husband to use to fish. Note: The picture here shows Kem M.'s husband.

loans.use: To repair fishing equipment and buy more fishing tools

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor Y., 30, is married. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia with her husband. To make a living, her husband and Y. raise ducks at her home, earning approximately US $12.6 collectively per day as a primary source of income for their family. This is Y.’s first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Mrs. Sor Y. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, Sor Y. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more ducks and duck food. With the remainder, she wants to purchase one more plot of farmland to do farming. (She is pictured with her husband and her young child.)

loans.use: To puchase more ducks, duck food, and a plot of farmland

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. S., 57, sells various kinds of vegetables in Psa Kompong Chhnang Market and earns approximately $3 profit a day. She also works on the farm in the village. She is a widow and a mother blessed with two kids. One is a local teacher and other one works in the garment industry. S. always has difficulty cooking because her house doesn't have a kitchen. Because of that, S. would like a loan from Kiva to build a new kitchen, which will make cooking easier for her.

loans.use: To build a new kitchen

loans.name: Madrona De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Madrona, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sembrando Futuro”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 65 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ya independientes.
Madrona, se dedica a la venta de menestras y lleva 24 años en este negocio, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Nº 2 - puesto Nº 17, y desde muy joven a Madrona le gustaba trabajar, por lo que poco a poco, fue ahorrando y haciéndose muy conocida por sus clientes, que hoy en día, son clientes fijos en su puesto. Nos cuenta que su negocio consiste en la venta de especias como: Maní y maíz crudo, tostado y molido, harina de plátano, para mazamorras, semillas de shicashica (fruto selvático) rico en aceite natural, algunas verduras como: fréjoles secos, cacao con harina de maíz, etc. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará en sacos de cacao, maíz y maní, para luego preparar mantequilla de maní, maíz amarillo, para la preparación de chichas, fréjoles en kilos, racimos de plátanos verdes,  para preparar harina de plátano.

Madrona, se siente muy orgullosa por el trabajo realizado durante tantos años, el buen producto que vende le ha proporcionado clientela fiel que compra todos los días y es muy conocida en el mercado. Agradace al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional a mujeres como ella.
texts.en:
Madrona belongs to the Communal Bank "Planting Future" in the Tarapoto District, San Martín Province, San Martín Department of Peru. She is separated, 65 years old, and mother of four children who are all independent now. Madrona sells dried vegetables and has been in this business for 24 years. Her business is located in Market No. 2 at Stand No. 17. Since she was a young woman Madrona has enjoyed working. Her business consists of selling products such as: raw, roasted, and crushed peanuts, plantain flour, cornstarch, shicashica (a jungle fruit) rich in natural oils, and some vegetables like: dry beans, cacao with corn flour, etc. With this loan of 2,500 nuevos soles, she will buy bags of cacao, corn, and peanuts to later make peanut butter, yellow corn for making chicha (maize liquor), beans by the pound, and bunches of green plantains to prepare plantain flour. Madrona feels very proud of the work she has done over the course of so many years. The good product that she sells has provided her with faithful clientele that buys from her every day and has made her very well known in the market. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for its unconditional support to women like her.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dried vegetables by the pound in sacks

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Ban V., 37, is married with a school-aged child. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia with her husband and her child. To make a living, she is employed as a chef for wedding ceremonies in the town and other places in the province, earning approximately US $9.9 per day as a primary source of income for the family. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Her husband operates a business renting the equipment for wedding parties, earning an income of US $5 per day. Mrs. V. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, V. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more cooking supplements to aid her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking supplements

loans.name: Yorng

texts.en: Yorng S., 38, is married and has a school-aged child. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia with her husband and child. To make a living, she grinds rice grains, earning approximately US $3 per day. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Her husband sells palm juice in the city, earning an income of US $5.53 per day as a primary source of income for the family. Mrs. S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to easily transport palm juice to sell in the city. By doing so, S. hopes that her family will be able to cut back on public transportation expenses.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita A. is from the village of Lilingayon Valencia City. She is 59 years old. Conchita is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Conchita owns & operates a business buying and selling cinnamon and peddling it around the village. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Conchita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Conchita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sour

texts.en:
Sour P., 41, sells various kinds of groceries to new and longstanding customers. She is married with two school-age children. She earns approximately $5 US per day. Her husband makes a living grinding rice grains, earning $7 US per day. They live in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

Mrs. P. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, P. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more rice to grind for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. P. is in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son S., 27, lives in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia, where she earns a living by selling firewood and charcoal. Son S. is a good mother of two kids: one is a student and the other one does not go to school.

She is married to Sopheap, age 34, who is a taxi driver. He was hired by a neighbor to drive a taxi. In view of the fact that firewood and charcoal selling is Son S.’s main source of income to sustain her family’s living conditions, and in order to better meet the needs of her customers, Son S. is applying for a loan as capital to accumulate a larger amount of her product for sale.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger amount of her product for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth A. is from the village of Bagontaas, Valencia City. She is 36 years old. Ruth is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from the buying and selling of herbal food supplements in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hard working mother.  She is 59 years old and operates her sari-sari store business (a community-based store). She is selling different kinds of goods and basic commodities in their village at Sinamar, Roxas, Isabela.

She is already a widow and was left with three children.  Being a mother and father to her children is difficult and this is the reason why she needs to work hard to provide the needs of her family.  However, due to a lack of financial resources, she was not able to send her children to school to pursue their college education.

At present, she would like to borrow additional business capital from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 6,000.  This amount will be used to purchase grocery items for the improvement of her business and to offer more goods to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
