She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for food-making

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 36 years old and married, with four children aged between 4 and 22 years. All her children go to school. She resides and owns a two room house where she is staying with seven people .Edith takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets two meals a day. She incurs additional transportation expenses traveling to and from shopping at the Mengo Kisenyi market .She owns a piggery farm in Makerere Kikoni one of Kampala's suburbs. She sells piglets ranging from one month to four months of age. If these piglets exceeds four months she retains them. Her pigs can produce about 60 piglets a year and a one month old piglet is sold at 10,000 UGX. Edith sells to all categories of people both on retail and wholesale. She works seven days a week and receives an average of 10 customers a day. Her major business challenges include defaulters and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place. Edith‘s monthly expenses includes school fees, and feeding the family. She has been in this business for over ten years and with MCDT for two years. She is servicing her fourth loan working with the same group mates. Edith joined MCDT because it was near her home.  Edith aspires to see her business grow bigger and start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more feed for her piggery.

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en: Khuon P., 30, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a garment factory worker who is able to make US$3.30 each day, while her husband is a construction worker and typically makes US$4 a day. This couple has two school-aged children. Khuon P. is asking for a loan of US$1000 as her husband needs to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Reun

texts.en: Reun R., 58, lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She earns a living by selling grocery inventory from her house, selling items such as cooked food and sweets for children. She is experienced and has been in this business for a long time. Reun R. is married andcurrently takes care of two school-aged children, with three other children already married. Her husband sells water to the neighbors for a profit. In the past, Reun R. always hired a taxi at a considerable cost for traveling purposes. She right now hopes to reduce those expenses by using a Kiva loan to purchase a motorcycle for her and her family's commuting needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her and her family's commuting needs

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim P. is 39 years old and sells vegetables in the Takeo province. Her business has been around for about ten years and she makes US$5 every day, while her husband is a construction foreman and makes US$2.50 per day. Selling vegetables has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and poor weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. She is asking for a loan of US$500 to invest into her own vegetable business, increasing her stock of vegetables to sell. She sees this investment as an opportunity that will increase her daily income.

loans.use: Invest in produce for her vegetables stand.

loans.name: Shir Del

texts.en:
Shir Del, the son of N. M., lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 40 and married with 3 children, two sons and one daughter. He is a carpenter and has been doing this work since he was 15. He is solely responsible for paying for the house rent and his children's school expenses.

He wants to expand his business, so he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to purchase more wood and to design nicer wooden things so that he can gain a good income. He is glad that to have this opportunity to progress and expand his business. He greatly admires the Kiva process.

loans.use: Purchasing more wood and other necessary items

loans.name: Zonie

texts.en: Zonie Occeña is thankful to KIVA for funding a previous loan requested through ASHI. Because it, her eldest child will be graduating as a nurse this year. Soon, she will be able to see the fruit of her hard work and determination in maintaining her business despite of the financial scarcity she often experienced because of insufficient income of her small business. Her husband provides only a small and sporadic income as a farm laborer. The interest rate she paid for the loan that she had requested through ASHI was worthwhile as it enabled her to finance the growth of her business and increase her profit. However, the battle against poverty is not yet over for Zonie and her family. She still has two children, aged 17 to 19 years old, that are in college which requires large amounts of money until they graduate. Zonie  is requesting a larger loan to be able to increase her business and profit which would be saved for her children and used to reach her dream of improving their standard of living.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase large volumes of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca S. is from the village of Baybay, Panalsalan. She is 45 years old, is married, and has seven adult children. Francisca owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Francisca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita Milliones wishes for a comfortable life at her age of 69. Throughout her existence of being a child and a mother, she had never felt how it is to live a life other than being poor.  This is the reason why, despite of her struggles in running and sustaining her business she remained strong and determined. She knew that she has no other option but to earn and support her 39 year old child who lives with her. The loans she has requested through ASHI have enabled her business to continue and profit. Juanita has now decided to lower the loan amount that she will request due to her capacity to pay and considering her age. Nevertheless, she still hopes that she will be able to grow her business..

loans.use: Will be used to purchase herbal medicines for selling.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda M. is from the village of Panduma Sr., Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Minda owns and operates a specialized "saging" (banana or plantain) retail store, buying and selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Minda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional bananas to sell. Minda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ghulam Rabani

texts.en:
Ghulam Rabani, son of A. M., lives in the 6th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 55, married with seven children - three sons and four daughters. He has a general store where he works with his elder son. He has worked as a shopkeeper since he was young, so he is fully experienced in his career.

He is a responsible father and pays for his sons' and daughters' expenses besides his house costs.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to purchase the things which are much in demand in his market. Also, he wants to have many clients.

He is happy that the loan process supports the ones who need money to progress their businesses.

loans.use: To progress his business

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mr. Pon P., 56, and his wife, Mrs. Yorn Horn, 52, were married in 1988 and have five  children - four sons, one a construction worker, another a farmer and another a student. One daughter stays at home. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Pon and his wife have been fishing and farming for over 20 years. Because the house where they live is small and old, Pon is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase wooden materials to make it stronger.

loans.use: To purchase wooden materials for renovating the house.

loans.name: Mouskéba

texts.fr: Mouskéba S. est une femme de 61 ans, elle mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO depuis 7 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 15 prêts. Avec son crédit elle achète du mil, le transforme en farine afin de préparer de la bouillie destiné à la vente. Ses bénéfices lui servent à participer au bien-être de sa famille
texts.en:
Mouskéba S. is a 61-year-old woman who is married and the mother of five children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO for 7½ years and has benefited from 15 loans from it.  With her new loan, she's buying millet and processing it into flour in order to make porridge destined for sale.  Her profits allow her to contribute to her family's well-being.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her small-scale business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 31-year-old married mother of four children between the ages of 4 and 12 years, all attending school. She resides in a rented two-roomed house with six people and also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets two meals a day.

Veronica owns a shop in Nakulabye that retails and wholesales a variety of merchandise needed in everyday life. She works seven days a week, receiving an average of 20 customers per day. Her major business challenges include defaulters and the rainy season because she works from a muddy venue. Veronica’s monthly expenses include school fees, food for the family, rent for both her business and residence, and transportation costs to and from her place of work.

She has been in this business and with MCDT for over five years, servicing her tenth loan working with the same group mates. Veronica is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise including sacks of sugar, boxes of soap, and cartons of salt. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to start selling on a wholesale basis exclusively.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like sugar, soap, salt and cooking oil

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeng T., 54, has been married with a new husband since 2006. Her husband is a construction worker. She has six children: three sons and three daughters. The eldest daughter works in a garment factory and another four are in school. They live in a small village along National Road Number 5 about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.
 
Loeng has been selling Ansorm (a kind of Cambodian cake made of rice paste wrapped in banana leaves) since 1979. Besides this business, she is a farmer and grows rice. She is asking for her first loan of $600 to use for growing rice.

loans.use: To use for growing rice

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is married with four children and she is 36 years old. She is an energetic woman and puts in long hours selling to ensure that there is food on her table to feed her family members.

Patience sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo State and has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to be a foodstuff distributor in future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin K. and her husband have been farming for 29 years. They grow rice on their farmland in the village. Sophoin is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to build a beauty salon for her daughter-in-law.

Sophoin, 42, and her husband, Mr. Chivorn Sot, 49, were married in 1982 and have six sons. One of them is married, one is a garment factory worker and two have full-time employment. The other two attend school. The family lives along National Road No. 1 approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sophoin is in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: To build a beauty salon

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells groceries and drinks in her community in Benin City, Edo State. She is a focused, hard-worker and is determined to excel in her business and family life.

Elizabeth is married with seven children and she is 58 years old. She is happy because one of her children is a graduate and she is being called “mama graduate” in her community.

Elizabeth has been in her business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: Georegette D., 58 ans, mariée et 7 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO depuis 7 ans. Avec son crédit elle développe un petit commerce de balais fabriqués à partir de feuilles de palmiers. son activité lui génère des bénéfices qui lui permettent de contribuer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Georegette D., aged 58, is married and has seven children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO for seven years.  With her loan, she's developing a small business selling brooms made from palm leaves.  Her business generates profits for her enabling her to cover family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop a income-generating business

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 36 years old and is married with five children. All her children are in school and she hopes to give them a quality education.

Roseline sells tubers of yam at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to sell her tubers of yam at wholesale prices in the future when she becomes the sole distributor in her community.

Roseline requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla N. has been selling fruit for over three years. Besides selling fruit, she also sells groceries at her house. Her husband is a mason. Phalla is requesting her second loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting and to buy grocery items for resale.

Phalla, 42, and her husband, Mr. Vit Sou, 41, live along National Road No. 1 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. Six of them are attending school. One daughter is a garment factory worker.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Tumur

texts.en:
Tumur B. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. His oldest daughter, Nandintsetseg, attends a local secondary school and his 2-year-old son, Baasansuren, has yet to start kindergarten. B. operates a household goods trading business at the local market in his town. He sells a variety of household and consumer goods out of a shipping container with the help of his wife. B. started his business in 2008 with capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~70 USD) after operating a business selling raw materials for several years. He has found success with his new business and has stable earnings. His profits have enabled him to provide financial stability for his family and to purchase a new car. Today, his working capital exceeds 1,600,000 tugrugs (~1100 USD). For the future, B. says, "I want to expand my business and hope to one day own my own shop." He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase new products to sell. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase new products to sell

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en:
Isoken sells groceries at the front of her house in Benin City, Edo State and has been in this business for seven years. She is determined to lift her business above poverty and hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

Isoken hopes for a loan of N30,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is 45 years old and married with two children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Baldandorj

texts.en:
Baldandorj C. operates a cellphone selling and repair business in his town. He is 22 years old and lives with his wife in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. They live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife is currently unemployed but is very supportive of her husband and works hard to make their home comfortable.

C. started his cellphone business in 2008 after working as a shoe repairman for the previous two years. Switching to the cellphone trade has quickly proven to have been a good idea. C. has established himself in the local business community and has a steady income. He is a very hardworking and open-minded person who hopes his business will enable him to achieve his future dreams. He hopes to have his own electronic appliance store in his town one day. C. is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase cellphone parts for his business.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase cellphone parts

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is 45 years old and married with 10 children. He has a large family to cater for. He sells over long hours to ensure that there is food on his table to feed his immediate family members. He is so determined to give his children quality education. He sells poultry birds. His poultry are kept in his house. He created a space to rear his birds. He said that it is cheaper for him since he does not have to pay for stall rent. He has been in this business for a long time. He hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more poultry birds to sell. This is the high season for his business and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a hairstylist and she also sells hair extensions and hair cream at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a focused, hard-worker who is determined to excel in her business and family life.

Patience is married with five children and she is 42 years old. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell.

This is the high season for her business and services and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell

loans.name: Farid Ahmad

texts.en:
This is Farid Ahmad H. A.. He lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 5 children. He is an educated man who has a drugstore. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to purchase more pills and some new chairs for his drugstore.

He wants to say that Kiva loans can support all the entrepreneurs to progress and bring new changes to their business and life. Finally, he would like to thank all the Kiva lenders a lot.

loans.use: To expand his drugstore

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 37 years old and is married with four children. She sells groceries at the front of her house. She is happy because she does not have to pay stall rent but she hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

Roseline is a hard working woman and has been in this business for four years. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell.

This is the high season for Roseline’s business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Kyyal's Group

texts.ru:
Мусабаева Кыял – лидер этой группы. У Кыял двое детей. Муж занимается частным извозом. Старшему сыну одиннадцать лет, а младшей дочке всего четыре годика. Сама же Кыял занимается домашним хозяйством. Она держит двух коров и продаёт молоко. В свободное время, она также занимается шитьём национальных изделий. Таким образом, даже находясь дома у Кыял, получается не только воспитывать детей, и выполнять обязанности домохозяйки, но даже зарабатывать существенные средства и тем самым пополнять семейный бюджет. Много лет тому назад у Кыял появился интерес к животноводству. Она решила проявить настойчивость и попробовать заняться этим. Она не побоялась вложить на покупку коров восемнадцать тысяч сомов (USD 420). За это время она с мужем смогла накопить достаточную сумму для покупки дома. Сейчас от продажи молока и шитья национальных изделий Кыял зарабатывает три с половиной тысяч сом (USD 82) в месяц. Это примерно равняется средней ежемесячной зарплате. Теперь Кыял хочет получить кредит и закупить 2-х телят для дальнейшего разведения и продажи на рынке. Кыял также хочет построить большой дом на полученную прибыль от продажи молока и национальных изделий, так как стройка требует вложения сразу большой суммы. 

Вот партнёры Кыял по группе: Миралан, Эльмира и Гульзат. 

Миралану двадцать два. Он уже женат и имеет дочку. Миралан занимается перепродажей скота на скотном рынке. Жена находится дома, дочке всего полтора годика. Миралан умело занимается своим делом и достойно кормит семью. Он надеется получить кредит и вложить в оборотный капитал. У Миралана есть заветная мечта накопить много денег и купить отдельную квартиру. 

Эльмире тридцать один. Она мать двоих детей. Младшей дочери всего три года. Эльмира работает продавцом в торговом центре «Народный». Её муж работает слесарем в г. Токмок. Благодаря совместным усилиям Эльмире и её мужу удалось сделать хороший ремонт в доме. Эльмира, решила обратиться за кредитом, для приобретения крупнорогатого скота. Перепродав скот, Эльмира планирует купить автомобиль.

Гульзат тридцать три года. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Гульзат работает продавцом – консультантом. Её муж – учредитель фирмы «Азия строй». Гульзат надеется получить кредит и вложить в торговлю потребительскими товарами. После получения прибыли Гульзат хочет купить себе машину.  
 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
M. Kyyal is the leader of this group. Kyyal has two children. Her husband is a cab driver. Her son, who is the oldest, is eleven years old and her daughter is just four. Kyyal herself takes care of the house. She keeps two cows and sells milk. In her free time, she also sews traditional national folk art and goods. In this way, even while staying at home, Kyyal is able to not only care for the children and fulfill her duties as housewife, but also to support the family budget. Many years ago, Kyyal became interested in breeding livestock. She has decided to take action and to try it. She wasn’t afraid to invest 18,000 soms (420 USD) of her own money toward the purchase of cows. Meanwhile, she and her husband were able to save up enough money for the purchase of a home. From the sale of milk and her folk creations, Kyyal currently earns 3,500 soms (82 USD) per month. That equals to her average monthly income. Now Kyaal would like to receive a loan to buy two calves for further breeding and for sale on the market. Kyaal would also like to build a large house on the income from her milk and folk goods sales, since construction requires the investment of a large sum of money all at once.

Here are Kyaal’s partners in the group: Miralan, Elmira, and Gulzat.

Miralan is twenty-two. He is already married and has a daughter. Miralan resells cattle on the livestock market. His wife stays at home, as their daughter is just one and a half years old. Miralan is a very capable businessman and provides sufficiently for his family. He hopes to receive a loan and to invest it towards his working capital. Miralan’s lifelong dream is to save up enough money to buy a private apartment.

Elmira is thirty-one years old. She is the mother of two children. Her youngest daughter is just three years old. Elmira works as a saleslady in the “National” shopping center. Her husband is a metalworker in the town of Tokmok. Thanks to a joint effort, Elmira and her husband were able to do a good job renovating their home. Elmira decided to apply for a loan in order to obtain a large cow. After reselling the cow, Elmira plans to buy a car.

Gulzat is thirty-three yars old. She is married and has two children. Gulzat works as a salesperson and consultant. Her husband is the founder of the firm “Asia Build.” Gulzat hopes to receive a loan and put it towards the trade of consumer goods. With the profits, Gulzat wants to buy herself a car.

Translated from Russian by Anastasia Uglova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock in order to finance various goals, such as building a home

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is married with 5 children and she is 38 years old. She is a friendly and happy woman. Stella sells daily from 7:00am to 6:30pm to ensure that she is able to put food on her table to feed her family. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. Stella is requesting for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for a long time. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mustafa Farid

texts.en:
This is Mustafa Farid, son of P. M.. He is 35 years old. He lives in Kabul Afghanistan. He lives in a family of 8 members. His brother is engaged and now he wants him to get married. But with the money they have, it is not possible for them to pay for all the expenses of the wedding. That is why he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to solve his problem and to have an organized and good wedding.

He would like to thank the Kiva lenders a lot because of their great support in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For wedding expenses

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 46 years old and married with 3 children. She is a hard working woman and sells local gin popularly known as “ogogoro” in Nigeria. Patience sells her products from the front of her house. The demands for her local gin are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. Local gin “ogogoro” is produced from fermented palm wine that has been processed locally.  She is requesting for a loan amount of 50, 000 NGN to purchase more supplies of local gin to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of local gin to sell

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet N. is forty years old. She is a widow and mother of five  working children. She has a retail hard ware shop which she has been running for over six years. Annet is requesting a loan purposely to purchase and increase the stock as well expand her business. She wanted to buy more building materials (cement, nails, pipes, etc) ito increase her supplies. Her business dream is to expand and increase her daily average sales. Her personal dream is to care for her family since she is alone.

loans.use: To purchase and increase her business supplies as well expanding on her business. To buy building materials (cement, nails, pipes, etc)

loans.name: Tida

texts.fr: Tida D. est une femme de 46 ans elle est divorcée et vit avec ses 3 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE CENTRE depuis 6 ans et demi. Avec son crédit elle vend sur étalage des pommes de terre et des oignons au niveau du marché de son quartier. Les bénéfices générés par son activité de petit commerce lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et d'assurer leur scolarité.
texts.en:
Tida D. is a 46-year-old woman.  She is divorced and lives with her three children, whom she supports.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE CENTRE for 6½ years.  With her loan, she's selling potatoes and onions all laid out at the markeplace of her district.  The profits generated by her small-scale business allows her to improve her children's living conditions and to ensure they have schooling.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her small commercial business

loans.name: Dorjsambuu

texts.en:
Dorjsambuu is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son, 8, attends a local secondary school and his youngest son, 3, attends a local kindergarten. His wife is a salesperson and works at the local market while Dorjsambuu operates a taxi service. He began his taxi business in 2005 and has gained a lot of experience since then. He and his wife are planning on opening a home goods retail business in the local market. He believes that they will be successful since his wife has a lot of experience selling these types of products and because he has experience owning his own business. Dorjsambuu is requesting a 700,000 MNT (~490USD) loan in order to import home goods from China so that they can begin their new business.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To import home goods from China so that they can begin their new business

loans.name: Diannah

texts.en: Diannah N. is a thirty years old business lady. She is married with seven children, all attending school. N. has a retail grocery shop in Kalisizo town which she has been operating for over six years. She is requesting for the loan purposely for business expansion. She wants to buy more bags of sugar, dry cells, salt, and a fridge. Her dream is to expand her business, increase her daily average sales and earn more profits. Diannah also dreams of becoming the best business lady in her area as in supplying in whole sale to earn more profit and so educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, dry cells, salt, and a fridge.

loans.name: Sangidorj

texts.en:
Sangidorj L. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. All three of her sons attend a local secondary school, and her husband works as an attendant at a fuel station. L. manages a flour trade business in her town. She travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, twice a month to purchase flour which she transports back to sell. She started her business in 2007 and has built a stable operation over the last two years. She works hard every day to grow her business and today, her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT (~2100 USD). L. continues to build on her business experience and hopes to expand in the near future. She says, "I hope to expand my business so that I can continue to provide for my children's education." She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan to purchase flour for her business.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To purchase flour for her business

loans.name: Nakabiri

texts.en: Nakabiri O. is thirty-two years old. She is a single mother of three children and also has three dependants that she takes care of. She has a retail grocery shop which she has been running for over three years. Nakabiri is using the loan purposely to purchase more retail stock, that is to say salt, sugar, soap, tea leaves, etc for business expansion. Her dream is to become the best competitor in the town of Kalisizo  and earn more profits to educate her children to greater heights.

loans.use: Supplies for business expansion (sugar, maize flour, rice, crates of sodas and so forth).

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 20 years old and single without children. She is a hard working girl and she sells for long hours to ensure that there is food on her table to feed her aged parents. She sells soup ingredients at Oka Market.

This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She has been in this business for a year. She hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more soup ingredients to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more soup ingredients to sell

loans.name: Memuna C

texts.en:
Here is Memuna C. K., a local entrepreneur in the northern city of Makeni. She is a dealer in spare parts for motorbikes and other light machines. She has been in this business for over sixteen years now. However, her business has not been growing as fast as she would like. She has thus come to SMT/Kiva in order to seek a loan of SLL 4,000,000 in order to help improve her business. 

Memuna was born in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have eight children together. Three of her children are attending secondary schools, four are in primary schools and one is already married and living on her own.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Makabe Group

texts.en:
Dotto Mohamed, age 30, is married with one daughter 10 years of age.  She has had a medical store since 2006 and works daily from 8am until 8pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $96.

This will be Dotto’s 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock by buying more medicine and has paid back successfully. She hopes for a loan to still increase on her stock of medicine.
	
Dotto will share this loan with her loan group, Makabe, which totals 21 members. The members of the group help each other in paying back the loan.  In the picture, Dotto is 4th from the right in the front row behind the desk, wearing white with a white headscarf.

loans.use: Increase pharmarcy stock by buying more medicine

loans.name: Unisa

texts.en:
Unisa T. sells motor vehicle spare parts in Makeni city. He wants a loan of SLL 3,000,000 which will enable him to improve his business. With a loan, Unisa will be able to buy additional spare parts for his shop. This will eventually lead to more sales and improved profit, and he will be able to take better care of his family and dependents.

Unisa was born in Alkaliya village, which is about forty-two miles from Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone. He is 36 years old and married to a businesswoman. They have three children – two in secondary schools and one in primary school. Unisa has been a businessman since 1996.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 46 years old and married with seven children. She sells akara (bean cake) at Oka Market. Akara (made from ground beans and it is eaten with bread or pap in Nigeria.) (Pap: ground maize or other cereal, soaked and softened to a semi-liquid state.) It is usually taken as breakfast in Nigeria. The demands for her akara are high, and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers.  She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN, Nigerian Naira, to purchase more beans to make more akara to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beans for making akara to sell

loans.name: Duger

texts.en:
N. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two of her four children in a house in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. Her two older children, ages 22 and 20, live and work in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her third child, who is 18 years old, attends the university, while her youngest child, 8 years old, attends a local secondary school.

Her husband is a construction worker in the summer months, and he helps N. with her business during the winter months. She operates a mobile food business in her town, selling food to office staffs. She began her business in 2000 and is now planning to open a café. N. is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (Mongolian Tugrik - MNT) loan so that she can furnish the room which has been added onto her house recently, and will serve as a café. XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To furnish the new cafe room

loans.name: Jjagwe

texts.en:
Jjagwe S. is 38 years old. He is married with three children who are all in school. He has four dependents he is taking care of as well, and they are also in school.

He has a clothing business through which he sells both retail and wholesale. He has been in this business for over eight years. He is using the loan to purchase and stock more clothes in order to expand the business. He wants to buy more skirts, trousers, tops, bed covers, carpets, shirts and blankets.

His dream is to expand his business and improve on his daily average sales for more profit. He also intends to educate his children to higher levels and to care for his family.

loans.use: To purchase and stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: N. Agnes is 32 years old. She has a retail grocery store which she has been running for over five years. She is using the loan for the expansion of her business. She wants to purchase items such as soap, rice, sugar and a refrigerator. Her business dream is to increase her business and her daily average sales. Agnes' personal dream is to educate her relatives and look after her family very well.

loans.use: To purchase soap, rice, sugar and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 36 years old and married with four children. All her children are in school and she hopes to give them a quality education. She is determined to excel in her business and her family life.

She sells medicines at retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo state. She has been in this business for two years. She hopes to be a major medicine distributor in Benin City. She is hoping for a loan of 80,000 NGN (Nigerian Naira) to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Faty

texts.fr: Faty S. est une femme de 29 ans, elle est mariée sans enfants elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE SUD" depuis un an et demi et y a eu des performances remarquables. Son crédit lui permet de développer un petit commerce d'effets vestimentaires pour hommes et femmes, de chaussures, d'effets de toilette et des sacs à main pour dames. Elle souhaite renforcer son activité afin de pouvoir augmenter sa capacité d'autofinancement, générer des bénéfices et soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge quotidienne de la maison.
texts.en:
Faty S. is a 29-year-old woman who is married and without children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE SUD" for 1½ years and has performed remarkably.  Her loan is allowing her to develop a small business selling clothing for men and women, footwear, toiletries, and women's handbags.  She wishes to bolster her business in order to be able to increase her profits and to support her husband with day-to-day household expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advance her small-scale business

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a 45-year-old married man with three children. He has owned a van since 1996 and he makes deliveries for clients upon request. He is asking to borrow $1,200 to pay for necessary maintenance for the van before the winter season starts, in order to be safe.

loans.use: Maintenance for his van

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en: Oussama is a taxi driver, and he supports his family with this business. He has been involved in this work for six years.  Oussama is requesting a loan of $1,000 to pay for maintenance and repairs for his taxi.

loans.use: For maintenance and repairs for his taxi

loans.name: Ndatté

texts.fr: Ndatté T. est une femme de 31 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. depuis un an et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE SUD" et y a bénéficié de 3 prêts qu'elle a remboursé sans difficulté. Son crédit lui permet d'acheter et revendre des chaussures et des noix d'acajou. Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent d'aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndatté T. is a 31-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children.  For 1½ years, she has been a member of Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE SUD" and has benefited from three loans from it.  She repaid them without difficulty.  Her loan is allowing her to buy and resell shoes and cashew nuts.  The profits earned will allow her to help her husband to support the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 36 years old and married with five children. She is a focused, hard worker. She has a grocery at the front of her house where she sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Loutfallah

texts.en: Loutfallah is a 47 years old and married with two children. He has been working in the flooring business since 1998 and has 20 years of previous experience. He's a very hardworking and punctual worker, and with his loan of $1,200 he will invest in buying new tools for his business.

loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Victoria Maria Carlos

texts.pt:
Victoria Maria nasceu na província central de Sofala, no distrito de cheringoma, tem 49 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 15 e 23 anos e encontram se todos a estudarem. Fez 11 classe e parou há muito tempo por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores. Vive com seu esposo e filhos na mesma casa (cedida pelos serviços) e sustenta também a sua mãe que se encontra na província na tal, enviando dinheiro para despesas correntes. 

Saiu de Sofala no ano de 2002 juntamente com sua família transferida pelos serviços para a província do Maputo e foi afecto no distrito de Boane. É membro da Policia da Republica de Moçambique com salário mensal no valor de 9.000,00mt que aplica no sustento da família e poupa algum valor no Banco comercial (BCI). O seu esposo também é Policia e afecto na mesma esquadra de Boane.

Vem construindo a casa em fase. Já teve empréstimos no Banco comercial (BIM) e depois de terminar o pagamentos decidiu aproximar se a Hluvuku-Adsema e desembolsou duas vezes para aplicar na compra de materiais de construção no valor de 10.000,00mt e 20.000,00mt, respectivamente.

Com o presente credito de 24. 600,00mt pretende comprar materiais de construção (cimento, areia, ferro e outros) para ampliar a casa e iniciar o murro de vedação.
Compromete se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder mais créditos com o intuito de finalizar o processo de construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Victoria Maria is from Sofala, central Mozambique. She is 49 years old, married and the mother of 5 children between 15 and 23 years old, all students. She finished 11th grade but had to drop school because of her parents financial difficulties. She lives with her husband and children and also supports her mother by sending her money for basic expenses. She is a member of the Mozambique Police Force and makes U$308 per month, money that she uses to support her family and save some at the Commercial Bank (BCI). She is asking for a U$850 loan in order to buy construction supplies (cement, sand, iron and others) to finish building her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies (cement, iron, sand, rocks, and others)

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en: N. lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a rented ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in a ger district on the outskirts of the city. She has a son, 9, and twin daughters, 7, who all attend a local secondary school. N. operates a household-goods retail business at the Bumbugur market, one of the largest and most well-known markets in Ulaanbaatar. She sells plastic and glass goods and some electronic goods used in food preparation and home upkeep. Her working capital now exceeds 2,000,000 tugrug and with the business profits, she was able to purchase a car for her husband to start a taxi service in order to supplement the family’s income. She hopes that both her and her husband’s businesses will enable them to have their own house in the future so that they can be more comfortable and stop renting a ger. N. is requesting an 800,000 tugrug loan in order to import more household products from China. XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team lending team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here here.

loans.use: To import more household products from China

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadores 1-3 Group

texts.en:
Iris, 46, lives near San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres Trabajadores (Working Women), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Iris and the other borrowers from Mujeres Trabajadores live in Consuelo, a small town north of San Pedro. Consuelo lacks potable water and the electricity there is unreliable at best. Iris lives with two of her three children, and she also takes care of her grandson. 

Despite the difficulties of living in Consuelo and an often-crowded home, Iris successfully runs a small business from her home selling new clothing. The most common type of clothes bought in the Dominican Republic are used and from a street vendor. Iris has tried to diversify her business by selling new products only.

Iris hopes that with this loan she will be able to start saving for her own shop outsiD. of her home. She would like to continue expanding her line of products until a person can buy any clothing from head to toe in her shop. In addition, she hopes that her grandson can grow up and attend college, giving him a step up in society. 

Thank you for lending to Iris and the Mujeres Trabajadores group!

loans.use: New men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Ibtissame

texts.en: Ibtissame is a married woman who has worked as a home-based tailor for 19 years. She's 52 years old. She began tailoring as a hobby and became well known in her town over time. Today, Ibtissame is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy a new sewing machine and an iron to expand her business and ameliorate her economic situation.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine and an iron

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2007, he decided to work as a builder after five years of experience in his own business. Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase more tools and materials because he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more tools and materials

loans.name: Estiveria Charcico

texts.pt:
Estiveria nasceu na província central de Tete, tem 54 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 6 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 3 e 23 anos e todos a estudarem. Nunca frequentou escola por falta de visão sobre a importância da mesma por parte dos seus progenitores. Vive em Boane na casa própria com sua família e envia algum dinheiro para seus irmãos em Tete. Perdeu os seus pais há muito tempo.

Saiu de Tete para Maputo no cumprimento do serviço militar de luta de Libertação Nacional do jugo colonial português. Sua esposa também foi militar e ambos são pensionistas, reformados do Ministério da defesa. Recebe 8.900,00mt mensais.
Para alem desta receita, faz comércio de produtos de primeira necessidade (vende feijões, arroz, amendoim e bebidas). Faz esta actividade há mais de 15 anos tendo aprendido fazendo e rende cerca de 3.000,00mt mensais.

Nunca teve empréstimos em bancos e teve informações sobre a Hluvuku-Adsema através de vizinhos e decidiu aproximar solicitando este seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000,00mt para compra e venda de produtos (bebidas, cereais e outros).
Compromete se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder a ceder a mais créditos com o objectivo de reforçar o negócio para ganhar mais dinheiro.
texts.en:
Estiveria is from Tete province, Mozambique. She is 54 years old, married and the mother of six children with ages between 3 and 23, all students. She never attended school. She supports his family and sends her brothers some money every month. She's retired from the military and so is her husband. She gets a pension of U$305 per month and to increase her income she has a business selling first necessity products (beans, rice, peanuts and beverages). She's been performing this job for the past 15 years and makes around U$102 per month. She is asking for a U$700 loan that she'll use to buy more food products and beverages to resell at her store.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages and food products for reselling

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is a 30-year-old married woman with four children aged between 4 and 12 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she lives with six people. She also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day.

Jalia owns a stationery shop in Nabulagala selling all types of stationery such as pens, exercise books, black books, masking tape, etc. She sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. She works seven days a week and receives an average of twenty customers a day and an income of 50,000/=.

Jalia’s major business challenges include defaulters and the ever-increasing price of stationery. Her monthly expenses include school fees, and feeding the family and rent for the business. She incurs additional transport costs to and from shopping for her stationery in the shops in Nkrumah Road in Kampala city center.

Jalia has been in this business for over four years and with MCDT for one year. She is servicing her third loan working with the same group members. She joined MCDT because it was near her home. She wants to use this loan to buy more stationery like books, pens and masking tape.

Jalia is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more stationery for her store

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is single. He has been working as a home electrician since 2005 to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Currently, Mohamad wants to borrow $1,000, with which he will buy tools and a compressor; this will allow him to satisfy the demand for his services.

loans.use: purchasing tools and a compressor

loans.name: Tacko Mbenda

texts.fr: Tacko Mbenda F. est une femme de 45 ans elle est célibataire et vit avec son unique fille. Avec son crédit elle va renforcer sa boutique en divers produits tels que des oignons de la pomme de terre, du sucre, du thé, de la boisson en canette etc. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de contribuer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Tacko Mbenda F. is a 45-year-old woman who is unmarried and living with her only daughter.  With her loan, she is going to bolster her shop with a variety of goods, such as onions, potatoes, sugar, tea, canned drinks, etc.  Her profits enable her to help improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her small commercial business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is 52 years old and married with 7 children. She sells diesel at retail prices in Benin City, Edo State. She works long hours to make sure that there is enough food on her table to feed her immediate family members. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of 80,000 NGN, which she will use to purchase more diesel to sell. She thanks all of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing more diesel to sell

loans.name: Hasib

texts.en: Hasib is a 23 year old single man living with his parents and his brother. He has been working as a blacksmith since 2004 in order to earn enough income to satisfy his family's needs. Currently, Hasib is applying for a loan of $1,200, with which he will to buy new tools that will help him expand his business.

loans.use: purchasing new tools

loans.name: Olinda Daiana

texts.pt:
Olinda Diana C. nasceu na província de Gaza, distrito urbano de xai-xai, tem 43 anos de idade e mãe viúva de 3 filhos com 2,10 e 15 anos de idade. Fez 6 classe na cidade de xai-xai e parou quando teve que ir ao lar. Vive na casa própria em boane com os seus filhos e sem ninguém mais por sustentar.

Saiu de xai-xai no ano de 2001 após a morte do seu marido e as cheias que assolaram muito esta parte dos pais (lembrar que foi neste local onde uma senhora deu parto sozinha em cima duma casa submersa e a criança teve o nome da Rosinha, esposa do antigo presidente americano). 

Vive de comércio neste distrito de Boane vendendo produtos de primeira necessidade (pão, acucar, vegetais e outros)
Já desembolsou 7 créditos com a Hluvuku-Adsema todos para a mesma actividade (dois de 6.200,00mt,01 de 8.000,00mt e 3 de 10.000,00mt) e pagou sem problemas.
No futuro pretende fazer crescer o seu negócio e ampliar a casa
texts.en:
Olinda Diana C. was born in Gaza province, Mozambique. She is 43 years old, a widow, and the mother of three kids ages 2, 10 and 15. She finished 6th grade but had to stop working to support her household. She lives in her own house with the children and doesn't support anyone else. She makes a living by selling first necessity products (bread, sugar, vegetables and others). She is asking for a U$600 loan in order to buy more products for reselling, diversifying her inventory and improving her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products for reselling

loans.name: Toomoi

texts.en:
Toomoi N. is 59 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in the Uvurkhangai Province of central Mongolia. His oldest daughter is a university student; his second attends a local secondary school; his youngest will soon start kindergarten. N. operates a small grocery shop near his house. He sells a variety of food products to the residents of his neighborhood. He started his business in 2005 after managing a firewood selling business for several years. N. is a very hard working person and is very focused on growing his business. He says, "All I want is to be able to provide for my children's education." He is thus requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan, with which he will purchase more grocery products for his shop.

Abut XacBank:

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia and also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision and scale to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team; to lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: purchasing more grocery products for his shop

loans.name: Chaaban

texts.en: Chaaban is a married man and the father of 5 children. He works hard to provide his family with good living conditions. He has been working as a farmer since 1995. Currently, Chaaban is requesting a loan of $1,000, with which he will purchase new agricultural tools that will allow him to increase the efficiency of his work and thus let him earn a higher income for his family.

loans.use: purchasing new agricultural tools
